, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u0928\u094d\u092e\u0928\u094b\u0924\u0940\u0924\u093e\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2225</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sixty times sixty\nyears and three<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">quarter Yugas had\nelapsed, twenty three years<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">had then passed SINCE\nMY BIRTH .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here, three quarters of\nYugas means Krita, Treta and Dwapara had elapsed and it was then Kali Yuga. It\nmeans 3600 years had elapsed since the beginning of Kali Yuga. Many scholars\nhave taken 3101 B.C. as the beginning of Kali Yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">So 3102 - 3600 = 499\nA.D.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">499 A.D. was taken as\nthe year in which the compilation of Aryabhatiya was done and die birth year of\nAryabhata is taken to be 499-23 = 476 A.D.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">BASTARDS --YOU LYING\nTHIEVING WHITE MEN -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL IS RIGHT BEHIND YOU . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">AYANANAMSA is the Sanskrit/\nMalayalam term in Indian astronomy for the amount of precession. In astrology,\nthis is the longitudinal difference between the Tropical (S\u0101yana) and Sidereal\n(Nirayana) zodiacs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In astronomy , this is\nthe difference between the length of a tropical year (365.2422 rotations of the\nearth) and a sidereal year (365.2563 rotations) required to complete one orbit\nrelative to the sun (tropical) or stars (sidereal)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Surya Siddh\u0101nta\nayan\u0101msa rises from 0\u00b0 to +27\u00b0 during 1800 years, then decreases to 0\u00b0 and\nfurther to -27\u00b0, thereafter rising again, thus oscillating within a rage of\n\u00b127\u00b0 instead of cyclically moving in a circle as modern concept of ayan\u0101msa\nsuggests. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(i) HINDU Yuga or the\necliptic rotation around a star takes 24000 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(ii) 24000 years were\ndivided by 12, or 24000 / 12 = 2000 years for each sign of the Zodiac<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(iii) The rate of\nPrecession was worked out as:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">360 / 24000 = 360 x 60\nx 60 / 24000 = 54\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(iv) 24000 / 360 =\n66-66 years or 1\u00b0 Precession takes place in 66-66 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rate of Precession\nof the Equinoxes as 1\u00b0 of precession in 66.664 years is close to the figure\nmentioned in Surya Siddhanta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per Surya Siddhanta,\nthe Precession of the Equinoxes is an oscillating one. It moves 27\u00b0 to the\nWest, retreats again to the zero point, again moves 27\u00b0 to the East and\nretreats again thus making an angle of 108\u00b0. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The to and fro movement\nof the Equinox is taken as one revolution. Therefore the above cited four\nrevolutions of to and fro movements have been taken as 2 revolutions. In this\nway when 108\u00b0 is divided by 2, the figure obtained is 54\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The variation in the\nrate of Precession of the Equinoxes invariably depends upon the revolution of\nthe ecliptic. If the period of revolution of ecliptic is taken to be 24000\nyears ( as per Veda Yugas of yore ) , the rate is 54\" per year and,\nslightly more than 50\" if the period is taken to be 25765 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/07/oort-cloud-hindu-yugas-and-breath-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/07/oort-cloud-hindu-yugas-and-breath-of.html</a><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no written\nauthority to accept the year 285 AD as the zero year of equinoxes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In astronomy, axial\nprecession is a gravity-induced, slow, and continuous change in the orientation\nof an astronomical body's rotational axis. In particular, it can refer to the\ngradual shift in the orientation of Earth's axis of rotation, which, similar to\na wobbling top, traces out a pair of cones joined at their apices in a cycle of\napproximately 25765 years. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">CONTINUED TO 3-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Delete<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">November 14, 2017 at\n3:49 AM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">CONTINUED FROM 2--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term\n\"precession\" typically refers only to this largest part of the\nmotion; other changes in the alignment of Earth's axis\u2014nutation and polar\nmotion\u2014are much smaller in magnitude.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the sidereal\nsystem defines the signs based on the fixed stars, the tropical system defines\nit based on the position of vernal equinox in the northern hemisphere (i.e.,\nthe intersection of the ecliptic with the celestial equator). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of the\nprecession of the equinoxes, the two systems do not remain fixed relative to\neach other but drift apart by about 1.4 arc degrees per century. The tropical system\nwas adopted during the Hellenistic period and remains prevalent in Western\nastrology. The accurate sidereal system is used in Hindu astrology<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/qutab-minar-was-dhruv-stambh-vishnu.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/qutab-minar-was-dhruv-stambh-vishnu.html</a><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hindu Jyotisha\nsystem of Kerala opted for defining the zodiac based on the fixed stars, i.e.,\ndirectly tied to the eponymous zodiacal constellations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Traditional Hindu\nastrology is based on the sidereal or visible zodiac, accounting for the shift\nof the equinoxes by a correction called ayanamsa. The ayanamsha is the\ndifference between the tropical and sidereal zodiac.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Tropical Zodiac is\nthe position of the sun referenced against the earth's horizon at a particular\nlocale which gives you the seasons as a measure of the flow of time. The\nframework for the 4 seasons are the 2 solstices and the 2 equinoxes. This is\nthe one STUPID PRETENDER western astrologers use.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sidereal Zodiac is\nthe position of the sun referenced against the star background, as a measure of\nthe flow of time. The framework for the star background is the constellations\nthe sun passes in front of. This is the one REAL Hindu astronomers use.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">We can measure time by\nthe seasons (tropical time) or by the stars (sidereal time). The sun, as the\ntime hour hand, is common to both. To compile the Tropical Zodiac no reference\nwas made to any stars.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sidereal zodiac (as\nseen by a person standing on the earth) is that belt of stars 7 deg either side\nof the sun\u2019s path (ecliptic) through the sky that is divided into 12 equal\nsized (300) constellations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sidereal Zodiac\n(Sidereal = Star) DOES take the precession of the equinoxes into account, and\nrather than beginning its cycle at the point of the Spring Equinox each year,\nit begins when the Sun aligns with a Fixed Star in the Constellation of Aries.\nThe Sidereal Zodiac is also known as the Fixed Zodiac.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=2&amp;v=-gh7wWVsPjo\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=2&amp;v=-gh7wWVsPjo</a><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vernal Equinox was\nin Libra sign in the year 11501 B.C.; therefore, to reach 0\u00b0 of Aries, the V.E.\nwould take 12000 years. Therefore the meeting of V.E. with the first point of\nAries took place in 499 A.D. (12000-11501= 499 A.D.) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit term Ayanamsa\nis the angle by which the sidereal ecliptic longitude of a celestial body is\nless than its tropical ecliptic longitude. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sidereal ecliptic\nlongitude of a celestial body is its longitude on the ecliptic defined with\nrespect to the \"fixed\" stars.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tropical ecliptic\nlongitude of a celestial body is its longitude on the ecliptic defined with\nrespect to the vernal equinox point.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tropical (sayana)\nzodiac is analogous to measuring the positions of trees and buildings sitting\nin a slowly moving bus. Sidereal (nirayana) zodiac, on the other hand,\nconsiders a fixed zodiac.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the sidereal zodiac\nfavoured by Kerala Hindu astrologers the signs more closely overlap with their\nconstellations. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Currently the\ndifference between the two systems, in terms of the sign placement of a given\nplanet, is about 23.5 degrees (the so-called ayanamsha). The ayanamsa, changes\ncontinually through the Precession of the Equinoxes at the rate of\napproximately 50\" a year.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">VEDAS ( WITH YUGAS\nEXPOUNDED ) WENT OF ORAL ROUTE FOR 330 CENTURIES BEFORE BEING PENNED DOWN 70\nCENTURIES AGO. THIS IS THE GREATEST FEAT OF MAN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu Roman Emperor\nJulian is called&nbsp; the Apostate, because\n37 years after Christianity was founded in 325 AD,&nbsp; and enforced in 337 AD by the Christian son\nof Constantine the Great ( Constantine II who poisoned his father )&nbsp; he tried to shelter the Hindu Essenes who\nstill survived and were practicing underground..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roman Emperor Julian was the\nlast non-Christian ruler of the Roman Empire, and it was his desire to bring\nthe Empire back to its ancient glorious Roman values .&nbsp; He restored destroyed and vandalized pagan\ntemples of Rome.&nbsp; Julian rejected\nChristianity.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He also forced the\nChristian church to return the riches, or fines equalling them, looted from the\nHindu temples after the Christian religion was made legitimate by Constantine\nII. Julian reduced the influence of Christian bishops in public offices. The\nlands taken by the Church were to be returned to their original Hindu owners<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Julain\u2019s &nbsp;paternal grandparents were Western Roman\nEmperor Constantius Chlorus and his second wife, Flavia Maximiana Theodora..&nbsp; Julain was Roman Emperor from 361 to 363 AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the turmoil after\nthe death of Constantine in 337, in order to establish himself as sole emperor,\nJulian's zealous Arian Christian cousin Constantius II led a massacre of Hindu Julian's\nfamily. Constantius ordered the murders of many descendants from the second\nmarriage of Constantius Chlorus and Theodora, leaving only Constantius and his\nbrothers Constantine II and Constans, and their cousins Julian and Gallus,\nJulian's half brother, as surviving males related to Emperor Constantine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constantius II, Constans, and Constantine II were proclaimed joint emperors,\neach ruling a portion of Roman territory. Constantius II then saw to a strict Christian\neducation of the surviving Julian and his brother Gallus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his School Edict\nJulian forbids Christian teachers from hijacking and using the Hindu scripts that\nformed the core of Roman education: &nbsp;\"If they want to learn literature, they\nhave their Luke and Mark: Let them go back to their churches and expound on\nthem,\" the edict says<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his Tolerance Edict\nof 362, Julian decreed the reopening of Hindu temples, the restitution of\nalienated temple properties.. Julian was assassinated by a Christian who was\none of his own trusted soldiers ( spear tip on liver while sleeping ) on orders\nfrom a rabid Christian named Jovian who became emperor and reestablished\nChristianity's privileged position throughout the Empire. Jovian would be poisoned\nwithin 8 months by &nbsp;Valentinian I who\nbecame emperor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jews boast--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe secrets of our\nholy Torah are revealed through knowledge of combinations, numerology ,\nswitching letters, first-and-last letters, shapes of letters, first- and last-\nverses, skipping of letters and letter combinations. These matters are\npowerful, hidden and enormous secrets. Because of their great hidden-ness, we\ndo not have the ability to fully comprehend them. Further, to see different\nangles through these methods is infinite and without limit. On this the Torah\nsays, its measure is longer than the world. &nbsp;Hebrew Scriptures were encoded with EDLS codes\u201d</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MY LEFT BALL !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IG2RQU2IzvM/XDJS6jZykcI/AAAAAAABfTM/VRriSJIrAvoJ-1lOPYy1Lg2eLgcGcYBGgCLcBGAs/s1600/dowSnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IG2RQU2IzvM/XDJS6jZykcI/AAAAAAABfTM/VRriSJIrAvoJ-1lOPYy1Lg2eLgcGcYBGgCLcBGAs/s400/dowSnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The God Code conmen&nbsp; used the flexibility of Hebrew orthography to\nhis advantage, freely mixing classic (no vowels, Y and W strictly consonant)\nand modern (Y and W used to indicate i and u vowels) modes, as well as\nvariances in spelling of K and T, to reach the desired meaning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is this&nbsp; tradition of writing the consonant \u201cyud\u201d\n(which is usually pronounced as a consonantal \u201cy\u201d sound) to represent the\nvowels \u201cI\u201d and \u201ce\u201d in certain words.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The letter \u201cvav\u201d\n(originally pronounced as a \u201cw\u201d but now mostly as \u201cv\u201d in modern Hebrew) is\noften used to indicate an \u201co\u201d or \u201cu\u201d vowel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebrew_alphabet\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebrew_alphabet</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most Jewish GOD CODE\nconmen are unaware that Jewish dates change at sundown rather than at midnight,\nhad an incorrect date. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We are supposed to lump that God would be HAJAAAAAR\ninterested in telling us that an Israeli Prime Minister would be assassinated,\nright ?</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WRONG !<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-uDk8DA7g8m0/XDJXCP5eB1I/AAAAAAABfTU/LCC0FEFX7SY-O9vBU6ry-y5ywJvg6sJpACLcBGAs/s1600/doFwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hebrew alphabet has\n22 letters. It does not have case, but five letters have different forms when\nused at the end of a word.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HEBREW WAS REVIVED IN THE END OF 19TH&nbsp; CENTURY BY ROTHSCHILD , TO CLAIM AND USURP\nTHE LAND OF PALESTINE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The revival process of\nthe Hebrew language took place in Europe&nbsp;\nthrough which the language's usage changed from the liturgical language\nlanguage of ancient Judaism to a spoken and written language used for modern\nlife in Israel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The revival of Hebrew\nwas a master plan by Zionist Jews in conjunction with carve out Israel policy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The characteristics of\nspoken Hebrew only began to seep into literature in the 1940s, and only in the\n1990s did spoken Hebrew start widely appearing in novels<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild employee\nEliezer Ben-Yehuda (1858\u20131922) is the \"reviver of the Hebrew\nlanguage\" .&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild made him\nspend four years in Paris and arrange to import a Jew from Jerusalem who was\nfluent in spoken Hebrew .&nbsp; They met in\nRothschild's hospital in Paris.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eliezer Ben-Yehuda\nraised the first modern Hebrew-speaking child, his first son&nbsp; Ben-Zion Ben-Yehuda (Itamar Ben-Avi)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Check out the advance\nplanning of Jew Rothschild.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He then sent Eliezer\nBen-Yehuda to Palestine to lay the ground work of the white skinned Jew\u2019s claim\nfor Palestine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He made a Rothschild\nfunded&nbsp; Hebrew dictionary Milon Halashon\nHa\u2019ivrit ha\u2019yshana vehakhadasha borrowing humongous amount of foreign words,\nslightly altering them,&nbsp; to make the\nliturgical rustic language modern enough to dabble in science and math.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While in USA , in\nsearch for words for his dictionary , he was a house guest of Rothschild\u2019s\nagent Jew&nbsp; Whorthiem in New York.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild got his\naccess to American libraries, being the only man ever to be given a room to do\nresearch at the New York public library on 42 street and Fifth Avenue. From\nthis you can see Rothschild\u2019s clout with the President of USA. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After his death in\n1922, his second wife Hemda ( sister of his first wife ) and his son Ehud,\nfinished his work.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eliezer Ben-Yehuda\nnever saw the creation of the State of Israel. He passed away only one month\nafter the British authorities declared Hebrew to be the official language of\nthe Jews of Palestine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild got him\nburied with great honours on the Mount of Olives in Jerusalem ( 1922 ) though\nthis man\u2019s ancestors ( Perelman ) were not from Palestine.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today the Hebrew\ndictionary has sixteen volumes plus an introductory volume called\nHa-Mavo-ha-Gadol (the great introduction) in 1959. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His work of the Hebrew\nwas a tool for Zionist success to show the planet that ancient Jews were\nintellectual scholars using modern technical words. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of these FAKE AND\nCREATED owrds cemented the theory that Israel was the homeland of Jew right\nfrom the days of Moses and the construction of the Egyptian pyramids. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today words used in the\ndead sea scrolls are being injected into this dictionary<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On his grave in\nJerusalem are the words \u201cein zo agada\u201d -- it aint no dream!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE STATE OS ISRAEL WAS\nBORN IN DECEIT .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MORE THAN HALF THE\nWORDS IN THE HEBREW DICTIONARY WERE&nbsp;\n\"INVENTED \" TO WOW THE PLANET&nbsp;\n..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS MAN JUST PICKED\nOFF WORDS FROM SCIENCE BOOKS IN EUROPE AND GAVE IT A HEBREW TERM.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT TAKES A CRIMINAL\nMIND TO DO THIS .&nbsp;&nbsp; HE USED&nbsp; WORDS FROM YIDDISH , SANSKRIT,&nbsp; ARAMIC, ENGLISH,&nbsp; LITHUANIAN,&nbsp;\nRUSSIAN , POLISH , ARABIC , GERMAN , SPANISH , FRENCH etc <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SEE HOW MODERN OUR\nJEWISH LANGUAGE IS -- WE CAN SEND MISSILES AND ROCKETS&nbsp; !?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN REALITY THIS ANTIQUE\nLANGUAGE WAS USED ONLY IN RIDICULOUS RELIGIOUS SERVICES <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ben Yehuda\u2019s Hebrew\nnewspaper HAZ-VI was owned by Rothschild.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HARDY ANYBODY KNOWS\nTHIS TRUTH.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit requires NO\neditions .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It has never borrowed \u2013\nonly given.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/sanskrit-digital-language-versus-versus.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/sanskrit-digital-language-versus-versus.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modern Hebrew\ndictionary should be called&nbsp; ABRACADABRA\n\u2013which magicians cry just before they make an ass of the audience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Hebrew language,\nit means&nbsp; \"I will create\" and\n\"as spoken\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FIT HAI BOSS !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ANY IDIOT KNOWS THE\nORIGINS OF YIDDISH AND \u201cHYBRID\u201d MODERN HEBREW .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern Hebrew is not\ngenealogically a Semitic language, as claimed by Zionist Jews .&nbsp; A major part of the underlying structure of\nthe language is Slavic , -- it has adopted the vocabulary and inflectional\nsystem of Hebrew.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">S is the subject, V is\nthe verb and O is the object; the three exhaustive elements of a simple\nsentence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Malayalam is\nsubject\u2013object\u2013verb (SOV) language is one in which the subject, object, and\nverb of a sentence appear or usually appear in that order. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If English were SOV,\n\" Dick apple ate\" would be an ordinary sentence, as opposed to the\nactual Standard English \" Dick ate apple\".&nbsp; Hindi is SOV.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hebrew is\nsubject\u2013verb\u2013object (SVO) is a sentence structure where the subject comes\nfirst, the verb second, and the object third. English is SVO.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BILBLICAL HEBREW WAS\nVSO&nbsp; LIKE CLASSICAL ARABIC .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SANSKRIT IS THE MOTHER\nOF ALL LANGUAGES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simple sentences in\nSanskrit do not need to follow any specified structure. They are attached\neither to the subject or the object in form of \u2018vibhakti\u2019. Thus, in principle,\nevery simple sentence in Sanskrit can be condensed into three distinct words:\nthe subject, the verb and the object.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nWe can write these three words in any order we want (all 3! = 6 ways)\nand the sentence will bear the same meaning. A unique meaning.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit like Malayalam\nis usually used in SOV format though.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit's grammatical\nstructure, words carry extra information with them. Because of this extra\ninformation, word order is more flexible in Sanskrit than in English.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN STUPID ENGLISH\nBANANA&nbsp; CAN EAT ELEPHANT, WHICH CANNOT\nHAPPEN IN SANSKRIT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit, uses\ninflection to a great extent.&nbsp; In\nSanskrit, a complex idea can exist as one word and still carry a single and\nprecise meaning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Malayalam and Hindi\nemploys postpositions, whereas English employs prepositions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Term/Definition<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grammar/The set of\nrules that describes or defines a language<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grammatical/used to\ndescribe an expression that follows the rules of grammar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subject/ In a sentence,\nthe thing that performs an action<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verb/ In a sentence,\nthe word that describes the action<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Object/ In a sentence,\nthe thing that is affected by the action<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emphasis/ a quality\nthat tells us to pay attention to certain words<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inflection/ the act of\nchanging a word to further clarify its meaning<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AIYYOOOOOOO !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE AWAITED MESSIAH OF\nTHE ESSENES IN THE DEAD SEA SCROLLS , WAS KALKI AVATAR OF VISHNU, AND NOT SOME\nJESUS CHRIST BORN IN A STABLE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The collection comprises\ndocuments of a varied nature, most of them of a distinct religious bent outside\nwhat would be considered normative Judaism. max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load.html?showComment=1546867040748#c6457707837779312556\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 7, 2019 at 6:47 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/god-code-by-timothy-paul-smith-damning.html<br />\n<br />\nSOMEBODY ASKED ME--<br />\n<br />\nHOW HAVE CUNNING JEWS PUSHED THE GOD CODE AGENDA FOR SO LONG WITHOUT BEING SPAT AT..<br />\n<br />\nWELL JEWS ARE GOOD IN HIJACKING STATISTICS, CHERRY PICKING , MASKING CONTEXT AND LOADED STATEMENTS..<br />\n<br />\nLET ME EXPLAIN IN DETAIL--<br />\n<br />\nNumbers themselves \u2013 unless purposefully falsified \u2013 cannot lie, but they can be used to misrepresent.. When you read a statistic, of any kind, be sure to ask how \u2013 and more importantly, why \u2013 the statistic was generated, whom it benefits, and whether it can be trusted.<br />\n<br />\nWithout critical and educated evaluation of statistics, the public could be misled by information that\u2019s misused, incomplete, or manipulated. Unfortunately, it seems that manipulation of statistics to further an agenda is becoming more common throughout society. Bad information propagated by government agencies especially is affecting policy decisions and harming the public when news outlets report it with insufficient examination.<br />\n<br />\nStatistics are supposed to make something easier to understand but when used in a misleading fashion can trick the casual observer into believing something other than what the data shows. That is, a misuse of statistics occurs when a statistical argument asserts a falsehood. In some cases, the misuse may be accidental. In others, it is purposeful and for the gain of the perpetrator. The false statistics trap can be quite damaging for the quest for knowledge.<br />\n<br />\nMisuses can be easy to fall into. Professional scientists, even mathematicians and professional statisticians, can be fooled by even some simple methods, even if they are careful to check everything. Scientists have been known to fool themselves with statistics due to lack of knowledge of probability theory and lack of standardization of their tests.<br />\n<br />\nCherry picking, suppressing evidence, or the fallacy of incomplete evidence is the act of pointing to individual cases or data that seem to confirm a particular position while ignoring a significant portion of related cases or data that may contradict that position. It is a kind of fallacy of selective attention, the most common example of which is the confirmation bias.<br />\n<br />\nCherry picking is done by cunning conmen intentionally. Cherry picking has a negative connotation as the practice neglects, overlooks or directly suppresses evidence that could lead to a complete picture. Cherry picking can be found in many logical fallacies. For example, the \"fallacy of anecdotal evidence\" tends to overlook large amounts of data in favor of that known personally, \"selective use of evidence\" rejects material unfavorable to an argument, while a false dichotomy picks only two options when more are available.<br />\n<br />\nCherry picking can refer to the selection of data or data sets so a study or survey will give desired, predictable results which may be misleading or even completely contrary to reality.<br />\n<br />\nSTUPID JUDGES WHO CANT THINK BEYOND THE OBJECTIVE, FALL PREY TO CHERRY PICKING AND LOGICAL FALLACIES.. BOTTOM OF THE SCHOOL CEREBRA BARREL JUDGES FALL PREY TO LOADED QUESTION FROM A CLEVER LAWYER TO A WITNESS.<br />\n<br />\nWHEN A CASE IS DELAYED BY TWO DECADES ( LIKE IN INDIA ) THE CONTEXT IF FORGOTTEN. THE JUDGE HAS DIED. THE ORIGINAL DEFENDANT AND HIS LAWYER HAS DIED.<br />\n<br />\nON MY SHIP I HOLD MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE MEETINGS EVERY WEEK. IT WAS ABOUT A TASK AT HAND AND ITS CONTEXT.<br />\n<br />\nCONTEXT MAKES A TASK EXCITING. THIS IS ONE OF MY LEADERSHIP SECRETS.. OOPS \u2013GAVE IT AWAY.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c6457707837779312556-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c6457707837779312556-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c8394502912339871424\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load.html?showComment=1546867158474#c8394502912339871424\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 7, 2019 at 6:49 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">CONTINUED FROM 1--</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">IN THE DAYS OF KERALA SAGE APOLLONIUS OF TYANA ( ON WHOM JESUS WHO NEVER EXISTED WAS MODELLED IN 325 AD ) THE ROMAN HINDU GODDESS OF JUSTICE HELD A MIRROR AND A BALANCE WITH A KING COBRA AT HER FEET. MIRROR SIGNIFIED CONSCIOUS AND SUBJECTIVE JUSTICE..</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THIS WAS CHANGED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD TO A BLINDFOLDED WOMAN WITH A BALANCE AND A SWORD. JUSTICE NOW BECAME OBJECTIVE SANS CONTEXT.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/08/objective-arguments-but-subjective.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">CONTEXTOMY MUST BE PUNISHABLE IN A COURT OF LAW.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">'Contextomy' refers to the selective excerpting of words from their original linguistic context in a way that distorts the source's intended meaning, a practice commonly referred to as 'quoting out of context'.</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The act of quoting a person out of context, is with the aim of winning an argument , by making an ass of the not so bright judge \u2013by deliberate obfuscation of the quote's actual meaning.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">A contextomized quotation not only prompts audiences to form a false impression of the source\u2019s intentions, but can contaminate subsequent interpretation of the quote when it is restored to its original context</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Cherry picking is the act of pointing at individual cases or data that seem to confirm a particular position, while ignoring a significant portion of related cases or data that may contradict that position..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Loaded statements are like icebergs: There's a little portion that you see, and a much larger portion that lurks below the surface.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">They typically carry associated meaning that's tied to issues of larger importance, but because they're delivered in an instant, the true import of such statements can sometimes be overlooked.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">You say something that will enflame passions in people, either positive or negative, and could also have a double meaning or a hidden meaning.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">A loaded question or complex question fallacy is a question that contains a controversial or unjustified assumption (e.g., a presumption of guilt)</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The fallacy of sweeping generalization is at work when a statistical average is applied to specific people. A sweeping generalization is when someone assumes something where it does not apply.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">When referring to a generalization made from a single example it has been called the fallacy of the lonely fact or the proof by example fallacy. When evidence is intentionally excluded to bias the result, it is sometimes termed the fallacy of exclusion and is a form of selection bias.</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THERE IS NOT A SINGLE JUDGE IN INDIA WHO HAS THE BRAINS TO FIGURE OUT WHAT I WROTE ABOVE</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">I WILL BE PENNING A FRESH POST ON THE SHIT QUALITY OF OUR JUDICIAL SYSTEM..</span></span></b><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">..</span></div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6VOqqm-hCbM/XCa06XjAUxI/AAAAAAABfL4/E3K2A6jHNG0XTf7_mZb9kjj9WxD3GwmzQCK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load.html?showComment=1546869470905#c132827656479618453\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 7, 2019 at 7:27 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nThe method of extracting information from enormous data is known as data mining. Data mining find its application across various industries such as market analysis, business management, fraud inspection, corporate analysis and risk management, among others.<br />\n<br />\nThe most damaging sources of misleading statistics is sampling bias<br />\n<br />\nON CHEMICAL TANKERS I HAD CREATED A FOOD PROOF SYSTEM FOR SAMPLING.. INITIALLY ROGUE SHIPPERS GOT VERY UPSET.. NOW IT IS THE NORM\u2026<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/11/sampling-procedures-chemical-tankers.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMANY SHIPS SANK BECAUSE THE CAPTAIN COULD NOT DO PROPER SAMPLING ..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/02/naive-sailor-transportable-moisture.html</span><br />\n<br />\nDATA MINING BIAS WAS USED TO PUSH HPV VACCINATIONS AND FLU VACCINATIONS IN INDIA..OF COURSE EVIL PHARMA DEPOSITED KICKBACKS IN SWISS ACCOUNTS.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/03/say-no-to-hpv-vaccination-for-indian.html</span><br />\n<br />\nI KNOW OF A NEW BORN BABY WHERE THE DOCTORS SAID THAT FLU VACCINATION IS COMPULSORY.. I AM SURE KOSHER EVIL PHARMA DARLINGS JP NADDA , MODI KNOW ABOUT ALL THIS.<br />\n<br />\nRead All 4 parts of the post below--<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/flue-shots-pneumococcal-vaccines-capt.html</span></div>\n<div>\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">DURING SABARIMALA SEASON PAMPA RIVER SAMPLES ARE TAKEN FROM SELECTED SPOTS WHERE WATER QUALITY SHOWS THE BEST..&nbsp; &nbsp;SO EVEN IF PROPER SAMPLING PROCEDURES ARE FOLLOWED\u2014THERE IS A MORE DAMAGING \u201cSELECTION BIAS\u201d..</span></b></div>\n<br />\nSelection bias is the bias introduced by the selection of data for analysis in such a way that proper randomization is not achieved, thereby ensuring that the sample obtained is not representative of whatever has to be analyzed..<br />\n<br />\nTHERE MUST BE STRICT PUNISHMENT FOR DELIBERATE SELECTION BIAS. GODs CODE ABOUNDED WITH SELECTION BIAS..<br />\n<br />\nSAMPLING BIAS MADE POL POT THE MODT EVIL MAN ON PLANET EARTH.. The words he found when searching for predictions were only\nconsonants\u2014to which he added the vowels to extract the FAKE results he wanted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The conman can\ndetermine the prediction by choosing which vowels to insert where . In\naddition, when you eliminate spaces and run letters together and then create\nnew words, you mutilate the original text and eliminate the original meaning!\nThis process of textual manipulation the conman researcher to find whatever he\nis looking for.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible Code is a\nclassic example of what errors can be committed when \"data-mining\"\noccurs\u2014when you simply look for patterns in large amounts of data. Recognizable\npatterns can be found, but that does not mean there is a definite relationship\nbetween the items\u2014the occurrences may be purely coincidental if not deliberate\nby cryptography tricks ! &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drosnins\u2019 &nbsp;methodology is so bad that it\u2019s a valuable\nexample of how not to read data&nbsp; . How\ndid this CUNT expect not to be caught with his pants down ?.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drosnin asserted\n\"when my critics find a message about the assassination of a prime\nminister encrypted in Moby Dick I\u2019ll believe them\" (Time, June 9, 1997, p.\n67). Yet Brendan McKay, an Australian mathematician, took up the challenge\n\"and found predicted assassinations of Gandhi and Nicaraguan president\nSomoza, among others\" in Moby Dick (Christianity Today, July 12, 1999, p.\n60).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God\u2019s code is an\nexample of FAKE predictions by a process of creative mistranslation.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In Genesis 25:11, \"after the death of\nAbraham\" is translated by Drosnin \"after the death of the prime\nminister.\" In Leviticus 26:12\u201313, \"[you] will be my people.
