Timothy P Smith was chosen by god , as he says !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The suggestion by\nconman Bible code researchers that in order to recognize and decipher the\nhidden codes you must understand Hebrew, have a high powered computer and be\nable to run sophisticated statistical analyses to verify your findings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The biblical texts on\nwhich Drosnin and other code researchers focus their attention clearly forbid\ndivination (Leviticus 19:26; Deuteronomy 18:9\u201314). The Bible also warns that we\nshould not listen to or be deceived by diviners (Jeremiah 27:9; 29:8).\nDivination is an attempt to foretell the future by some physical means.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These\nbastards dont even know their subject !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the medieval period,\ntwo books were written, supposedly from those who had orally passed such secret\nEMBEDDED knowledge down during all those centuries. Two books form the crux of\ntheir doctrinal teachings. The \u2018BOOK OF CREATION\u2019, and the \u2018ZOHAR\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The Book of\nCreation\" is six chapters long, in 33 sections, written in Mishnic Hebrew.\nAccording to the Kabbalah-ists, it was written by Rabbi Akiba in 120 A.D. It\nclaims to be a monologue of Abraham telling the ways of wisdom by which God\nproduced the universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sefer Yetzirah (Book of\nCreation) is the title of the earliest extant book on Jewish esotericism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sefer Yetzirah is\nexceedingly difficult to understand on account of its obscure style. You can\nderie any fuckin\u2019 meaning out of it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ideas of heaven and\nhell are left unmentioned in the book<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first sentence of\nthe book reads: \"Thirty-two paths, marvels of wisdom, hath God\nengraved...,\" these paths being then explained as the ten Sefirot and the\ntwenty-two letters. While the Sefirot are expressly designated as\n\"abstracts\", it is said of the letters: \"Twenty-two letters: God\ndrew them, hewed them, combined them, weighed them, interchanged them, and\nthrough them produced the whole creation and everything that is destined to\ncome into being\" (ii. 2)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BALLS - SEMITES ( LEFT\nHANDED YOUNGER BROTHERS OF KERALA NAMBOODIRIS ) CREATED THE 22 HEBREW\nALPHABETS..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jewish Rabbis who had\nmastered the Sefer Yetzirah, a text believed to describe the manner in which\nGod created life, were able to create a \"golem\" out of clay, to\ncreate a new Adam. The text is the foundation for the Kabbalistic school of\nthought: that numbers and combinations of the 22 Hebrew letters were used to\nform all things, and that God's name possesses the power of life and death<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Golem is an animated\nanthropomorphic being that is magically created entirely from inanimate matter like\nmud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word golem occurs\nonce in the Bible in Psalm 139:16, which uses the word &nbsp;that means , \"raw\" material,\nconnoting the unfinished human being before God's eyes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Golem\"\npassed into Yiddish as goylem to mean someone who is stupid .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was believed that\ngolems could be activated by an ecstatic experience induced by the ritualistic\nuse of various letters of the Hebrew Alphabet forming a \"shem\" (any\none of the Names of God), wherein the shem was written on a piece of paper and\ninserted in the mouth of the golem.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oldest description\nof the creation of a golem by a historical figure is included in a tradition\nconnected to Rabbi Eliyahu of Che\u0142m (died 1583 AD).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Zohar\" is\nthe \u2018Bible\u2019 of the Kabbalah-ists.&nbsp;&nbsp; It is\nin Aramaic, and is a commentary on the Pentateuch.&nbsp; It is 52 lessons.&nbsp; The word \u2018zohar\u2019 means \u2018light, splendor\u2019. It\nwas really composed by a Spanish Jew, a charlatan &nbsp;named Moses of Leon in 1305 A.D.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kabbalah heresy was\nand is a Jewish mysticism practice. . The Torah (Pentateuch) has 304,805 Hebrew\nletters. The Kabbalah-ists believe that hidden in those letters are this secret\nwisdom meant for those with the intelligence or gift to find such. To the\nKabbalah-ists, every letter of the Hebrew language is a channel to God or to\nHis message for us. Finding the hidden messages was and still is the past time\nof Kabbalah-ists.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the patterns\nsought in the Scriptures is called \u2018TEMURAH\u2019. In it they change each letter with\nanother one, and then seek to find words of the new letter arrangement. They\nchange \u2018aleph\u2019 the first letter of the alphabet with \u2018lamed\u2019, the twelfth\nletter of the alphabet, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three simple\nforms of Temurah:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atbash: Replacing the\nfirst letter with the last letter of the Hebrew alphabet, the second with the\nnext-to-last, and so on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a=z, b=y, c=x, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avgad: Replacing each\nletter with the preceding letter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a=b, b=c, c=d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Albam: Replacing the\nfirst letter of the alphabet with the twelfth, the second with the thirteenth,\nand so on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a=l, b=m, c=n, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kabbalists rearrange\nwords and sentences in the Bible, in the belief that by this method they can\nderive the esoteric substratum and deeper spiritual meaning of the words.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Notarikon &nbsp;is a method of deriving a word, by using each\nof its initial or final letters to stand for another, to form a sentence or\nidea out of the words. Another variation uses the first and last letters, or\nthe two middle letters of a word, in order to form another word.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WANNA TEAR YOUR HAIR IN\nGRIEF ?&nbsp; MAKE A HOLE IN YOUR TROUSER\nPOCKET FIRST !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YEH LEH !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bible codes cannot\nforetell future events. In the Bible codes, there are no secret sentences, no\ndetailed messages, no theological statements. There are only random key words,\nnames, and a few phrases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The resurgence of the\nBible code searchings, and the strange date setting and event predicting that\nis now accompanying it, are from a doctrine started long ago by evil JEWS who\nwanted to grab power..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a scribe copied\nthe manuscript of Genesis, which has 76,064 letters, he would count out the\nprecise number of times each of the 22 letters of the Hebrew text was used. On\neach page, the number would be noted. If one letter was missed, or one added,\nthe whole copy being done was destroyed.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This precision and\ncarefulness of copying was not just \u2018typical\u2019, it was a mandatory exercise.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To avoid omitting even\na single letter from the Bible text, they went so far as to count not just the\nwords copied but the letters as well. Consider the painstaking care this\ninvolved: They reportedly kept track of 815,140 individual letters in the\nHebrew Scriptures</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">]</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the 815,140 letters\nwere put into a huge bowl, in the exact number of each letter as noted above,\nand one would pour out a table full, randomly, there would be oft times that\nthe four letter of \u2018Yeshua\u2019 would occur. These random findings would be similar\nto the findings of words, and occasional phrases, as found by the ELS method.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To try to show prophetic significance to some random words, names, or phrases\nis BULLSHIT. To base doctrines or teachings on such things is totally a demonic\nattempt to MAKE A CHOOT out of people.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Australian atheist\nentertainer John Safran proving conclusively beyond a shadow of a doubt that\nAmerican rapper Vanilla Ice was involved in the U.S. World Trade Center attacks\nby utilizing Drosnin baby\u2019s &nbsp;scientific\nmethods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There were books\nwritten during the Old Testament period that claimed the author was actually a\nbiblical character. However these works were nothing but forgeries. These\nforgeries were known as Old Testament Pseudepigrapha. We find the same sort of\nthing happening during the New Testament era. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Writers would claim\nthat there work was actually the work of one of the New Testament characters\nwhen, in actuality, it was a forgery. Therefore we also have the New Testament\nPseudepigrapha. One of the most important of the New Testament Pseudepigrapha\nis, \"The Gospel of Thomas.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pseudepigrapha are\nfalsely-attributed works, texts whose claimed author is not the true author, or\na work whose real author attributed it to a figure of the past..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FAKE Gospel of\nThomas is a non-canonical sayings gospel. It was \u201cdiscovered\u201d near Nag Hammadi,\nEgypt, in December 1945..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By using the Coptic\nlanguage we are supposed to believe that it was written in 350 AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FAKE Gospel of\nThomas is very different in tone and structure from other New Testament\napocrypha and the four Canonical Gospels. Unlike the canonical Gospels, it is\nnot a narrative account of the life of Jesus; instead, it consists of logia\n(sayings) attributed to Jesus, sometimes stand-alone, sometimes embedded in\nshort dialogues or parables<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThomas\u201d consists of a\ncollection of 114 \u201csayings of Jesus,\u201d that are supposed to be a secret\nrevelation the Lord gave to the apostle Thomas. That secret business itself\nought to be a red flag<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of the sayings are\ncontradictory to those we have in the Gospels. For example, saying 114 says:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus said, 'See, I\nshall lead her, so that I will make her male, that she too many become a living\nspirit, resembling you males. For every woman who makes herself male will enter\nthe Kingdom of Heaven.' In the Gospels Jesus is God the Son, Second Person of\nthe Trinity. In the Gospel of Thomas He is one who points the way by which an\nindividual can attain the knowledge of God.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simon Peter said to\nthem: \u201cLet Mary (Magdalene) go out from among us, because women are not worthy\nof the Life.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus said: \u201cSee I\nshall lead her, so that I will make her male, that she too may become a living\nspirit, resembling you males. For every woman who makes herself male will enter\nthe Kingdom of Heaven.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ever heard of the FAKE Gospel\nof Judas&nbsp; ( who never existed ) ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gospel of Judas , was a\n&nbsp;leather-bound Coptic language papyrus\ndocument that surfaced during the 1970s, near Beni Masar, Egypt\u2014re-surfaced\n1700 years after it was written..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It relates relates the\nstory of Jesus's death from the viewpoint of Judas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gospel of Judas\nconsists of 16 chapters which document Jesus's teaching about spiritual matters\nand cosmology. According to the text, Judas is the only one of Jesus's\ndisciples who accurately understands the words of his master.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fyTNyIfwAWU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fyTNyIfwAWU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Genesis\nand Deuteronomy (Genesis 15:18, 17:8 and Deuteronomy 1:7-8), Abraham and his\ndescendants, the JEW Israelites will unconditionally (Deuteronomy 9:3-7) own\nall the land between the Nile River and the Euphrates River for an everlasting\npossession. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ISRAEL WANTS THEIR NATION\nTO HAVE ONE LEG IN PERSIAN GULF AND ANOTHER IN RED DEA. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Isaiah\n17:1, \"Damascus will no longer be a city but will become a heap of\nruins\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS WHAT IS\nHAPPENING TO PRESIDENT ASSAD .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8O_IEPZnbJo/XDOTknnEyXI/AAAAAAABfUI/aDcKWN55oyIbbQQXPT0m2WkvdqHRNmaLwCLcBGAs/s1600/khaSEzaria.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Nq7MawfWrnw/XDOUBsdoVFI/AAAAAAABfUQ/kmY1q4Frq84T-Ncv0ZWssZCD1_dmbFF1QCLcBGAs/s1600/iYmagesNRTE6U7R.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The deuterocanonical\nbooks (from the Greek meaning \"belonging to the second canon\") are\nbooks and passages considered by the Catholic Church and the Eastern Orthodox\nChurch to be canonical books of the Old Testament but which are considered\nnon-canonical by Protestant denominations. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/03/protestant-christianity-created-by-jews.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/03/protestant-christianity-created-by-jews.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are seven books\nfrom the Septuagint, the standard translation of the Hebrew Bible in the\nHellenistic period, written after 325 AD..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hebrew Bible, also\ncalled the Tanakh, is the canonical collection of Jewish texts, which is also\nthe textual source for the Christian Old Testament. These texts are composed\nmainly in Biblical Hebrew, with some passages in Biblical Aramaic..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The form of\nthis text that is authoritative for Rabbinic Judaism is known as the Masoretic\nText (MT), and is divided into 24 books, while the Protestant Bible translations\ndivide the same material into 39 books.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tanakh is an acronym of the first Hebrew letter of each of the Masoretic\nText's three traditional subdivisions: Torah (\"Teaching\", also known\nas the Five Books of Moses), Nevi'im (\"Prophets\") and Ketuvim\n(\"Writings\")\u2014hence TaNaKh. The books of the Tanakh were passed on by\neach generation and, according to rabbinic tradition, were accompanied by an\noral tradition, called the Oral Torah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1 Enoch was excluded\nfrom both the formal canon of the Tanakh and the typical canon of the\nSeptuagint and therefore, also from the writings known today as the\nDeuterocanon. It is termed \u201cpseudepigrapha,\u201d which means \u201cfalse writings..\nNames as Ezra, Baruch, Enoch, Solomon, Moses, and Adam are used to add\nauthority to the writing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The deuterocanonical\nbooks (from the Greek meaning \"belonging to the second canon\") are\nbooks and passages considered by the Catholic Church and the Eastern Orthodox\nChurch to be canonical books of the Old Testament but which are considered non-canonical\nby Protestant denominations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apocrypha are works,\nusually written, of unknown authorship or of doubtful origin..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While Catholic\ntradition considers some of these texts to be deuterocanonical, Protestants\nconsider them apocryphal. Thus, Protestant bibles do not include the books\nwithin the Old Testament but have often included them in a separate section.\nOther non-canonical apocryphal texts are generally called pseudepigrapha, a\nterm that means \"false writings\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luther did not include\nthe deuterocanonical books in his Old Testament, terming them \"Apocrypha,\nthat are books which are not considered equal to the Holy Scriptures<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; 1 Enoch&nbsp;\nis any of several pseudepigraphal (falsely attributed works, texts whose\nclaimed authorship is unfounded) works that attribute themselves to Enoch, the\ngreat-grandfather of Noah; that is, Enoch son of Jared (Genesis 5:18). Enoch is\nalso one of the two people in the Bible taken up to heaven without dying (the\nother being Elijah), as the Bible says \"And Enoch walked with God, and he\nwas not; for God took him.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Book of Enoch uses\nunfamiliar terminology, referring to the \"Lord of Spirits\" The reason\nwhy the early church fathers and the King James Bible translators rejected the\nBook of Enoch as inspired of God, WASN'T to hide the truth; BUT, because it\nisn't the truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Sir Walter Raleigh, in\nhis History of the World (written in 1616 while imprisoned in the Tower of\nLondon), makes the curious assertion that part of the Book of Enoch \"which\ncontained the course of the stars, their names and motions\" had been\ndiscovered in Saba (Sheba/ Malabar ) in the first century.. century and was\nthus available to Origen and Tertullian\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Tertullian was the\nfirst Christian author to produce an extensive corpus of Latin Christian\nliterature.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Hindu Origen , a sage\nfrom Kerala, a librarian at Alexandria has been described as \"the greatest\ngenius the early church ever produced\" he wrote a grand total of roughly\n6,000 works over the course of his lifetime..&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">He was the student of Hindu\nKerala sage Ammonius Saccas who was the teacher of Greek philosopher Plotinus<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">The Sabeans or people\nof Saba or Sheba ( North Kerala. Malabar ) , are referred to as traders in gold\nand spices, and as inhabiting a country remote from Palestine (1 Kings 10:1\nIsaiah 60:6 Jeremiah 6:20 Ezekiel 27:22 Psalm 72:15 Matthew 12:42)</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">THIS BLOGSITE REJECTS THE PATHETIC LIES IN THE TORAH RELATING\nTO PATRIARCHS , THE EXODUS, AND THE CONQUEST OF CANAAN DESCRIBED IN THE BOOK OF\nJOSHUA \u2026 &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: x-large;\">ALL THIS IS BULLSHIT ISRAELI&nbsp; KOSHER NATIONAL PRIDE. ..&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\">NO ANCIENT JEWISH &nbsp;BOOKS ABOUT MOSES IN EGYPT , EVER TALKS ABOUT\nEGYPTIAN PYRAMIDS ..&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\">REVERSE ENGINEERING BY PLANTING FAKE KOSHER ARTIFACTS WONT WORK ANYMORE !</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bullshit COOKED UP Book\nof Joshua is the sixth book in the Hebrew Bible (the Christian Old Testament)\nand the first book of the Deuteronomistic history, the story of Israel from the\nconquest of Canaan to the Babylonian exile.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It tells of the campaigns of the Israelites in central, southern and\nnorthern Canaan, the destruction of their enemies, and the division of the land\namong the Twelve Tribes, framed by two set-piece speeches, the first by God\ncommanding the conquest of the land, and, at the end, the last by Joshua\nwarning of the need for faithful observance of the Law (torah) revealed to\nMoses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The view that the Bible\nshould be accepted as historically accurate and as a reliable guide to morality\nis NONSENSE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biblical minimalism is\na label applied to a loosely knit group of scholars who hold that the Bible's\nLYING &nbsp;version of history.&nbsp; The Bible cannot be trusted as a history\nsource at all.&nbsp; Pseudepigrapha within the\nNew Testament invalidates it as a reliable source of information.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT IS A LIE THAT MOSES\nWROTE THE TORAH, AS DICTATED BY GOD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here is a doctrines\nmade by Jesus in the New Testament. One example that is often cited is the\nbiblical law of the rebellious son:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"If any man has a\nstubborn and rebellious son who will not obey his father or his mother, and\nwhen they chastise him, he will not even listen to them, then his father and\nmother shall seize him, and bring him out to the elders of his city at the\ngateway of his home town. And they shall say to the elders of his city, 'This\nson of ours is stubborn and rebellious, he will not obey us, he is a glutton\nand a drunkard.' Then all the men of his city shall stone him to death; so you\nshall remove the evil from your midst, and all Israel shall hear of it and\nfear.\" (Deut. 21:18-21)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many versions of the\nBible specifically point out that the most reliable early manuscripts and other\nancient witnesses did not include Mark 16:9-20, i.e., the Gospel of Mark\noriginally ended at Mark 16:8, and additional verses were added a few hundred\nyears later. This is known as the \"Markan Appendix\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mosaic authorship,\nauthorship of the Gospels and authorship of the Pauline Epistles are all a LIE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Genesis creation\nnarrative is the creation myth of both Judaism and Christianity. The narrative\nis made up of two stories, roughly equivalent to the first two chapters of the\nBook of Genesis. The cosmos was not created in 4004 BC\u2014as per the Vedas it is\n14 billion years old..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the first, Elohim\n(the Hebrew generic word for God) creates the heavens and the earth in six\ndays, then rests on, blesses and sanctifies the seventh. In the second story,\nGod, now referred to by the personal name Yahweh, creates Adam, the first man,\nfrom dust and places him in the Garden of Eden, where he is given dominion over\nthe animals. Eve, the first woman, is created from Adam and as his companion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although tradition\nattributes Genesis to Moses, &nbsp;together\nwith the following four books (making up what Jews call the Torah and biblical\nscholars call the Pentateuch), is a composite work, the product of many LYING\nMINDS and periods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The story of Genesis is\nMINDLESS NONSENSE .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The kosher liars needed\nto invoke miracles in order to compress the events of the earth's history into\nthe biblical span of a few thousand years. It is nonsense that all fossils are\nproducts of Noah's flood&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Israelites were\nnever in Egypt, did not wander in the desert for 40 years eating manna, did not\nconquer the land in a military campaign and did not pass it on to the 12 tribes\nof Israel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fulfillment of\nbiblical prophecies is a popular argument used as evidence by Christian\napologists to support the claimed divine inspiration of the Bible which was\ncooked up in 325 AD at the First Council of Nicea.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ridiculous claims\nthat JEW Jesus is the messiah of the Hebrew Bible are based on LIES .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Isaiah 7:14.\nChristians read Isaiah 7:14 as a prophetic prediction of Jesus' birth from a\nvirgin, while Jews read it as referring to the birth of Ahaz's son, Hezekiah.&nbsp; The Bible describes Hezekiah as a king who\nhad a close relationship with God, one who did \u201cwhat was good and right and\nfaithful before the LORD his God\u201d (2 Chronicles 31:20).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hezekiah\u2019s story is\ntold in 2 Kings 16:20\u201420:21; 2 Chronicles 28:27\u201432:33; and Isaiah 36:1\u201439:8. He\nis also mentioned in Proverbs 25:1; Isaiah 1:1; Jeremiah 15:4; 26:18\u201319; Hosea\n1:1; and Micah 1:1.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN REALITY JESUS WAS\nCOOKED UP BASED ON THE LIFE OF APOLLONIUS OF TYANA A KERALA SAGE .. HIS\nSIDEKICK DAMISAs WIFE WAS A KERALA NAMBOODIRI WOMAN MARY MAGDALENE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Almah, used in\nIsaiah 7:14, is part of the Hebrew phrase ha-almah hara, meaning \"the\nalmah is pregnant.\" Since the present tense is used, it means &nbsp;that the young woman was already pregnant and\nhence not a virgin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Little Apocalypse is\n&nbsp;recorded in the Olivet Discourse of the\nGospel of Mark. It predicts the siege of Jerusalem and destruction of the\nJewish Temple at the hands of the Romans in 70 AD. &nbsp;This is an ex eventu (foretelling after the\nevent), as are many of the prophecies in the Old Testament such those of Daniel\n11..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Book of Joshua\ndescribes the Israelite conquest of Canaan under the leadership of Joshua, the\nson of one of the aides to Moses. After Moses' death, God tells Joshua to\nconquer Canaan and makes predictions of his success. Amongst other things,\nJoshua was to be given a vast dominion that included all of the Hittite land,\nand the advantage of facing no one who could stand up to him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Genesis\nand Deuteronomy (Genesis 15:18, 17:8 and Deuteronomy 1:7-8), Abraham and his\ndescendants, the Israelites will unconditionally (Deuteronomy 9:3-7) own all\nthe land between the Nile River and the Euphrates River for an everlasting\npossession.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ALL KNOW THIS IS A WET DREAM FOR ISRAEL\u2014TO HAVE A GREATER ISRAEL\nNATION WITH ONE LEF IN THE PERSIAN GULF AND ANOTHER IN THE RED SEA..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Was Yeshua bringing a\nnew message?
