Yeshua brought the promised\nnew covenant to the House of Israel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus said: \u201cDo not\nthink that I have come to abolish the Torah or the Prophets! I have not come to\nabolish, but to fulfill\u201d (Matthew 5:17 TLV).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus promised the new\ncovenant: \u201c\u2018But this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after\nthose days,\u2019 it is a declaration of Adonai, \u2018I will put My Torah within them.\nYes, I will write it on their heart\u2019\u201d (Jeremiah 31:33 TLV).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Romans 1:16 is clear\nthat the Gospel is not only to the Jew but to the Jew first. Paul cried out in\nRomans 9:1-4 that he would give up his own salvation for the sake of his\nbrethren, the Jews.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The declaration in Acts\n4:12: \u201cThere is salvation in no one else, for there is no other name under\nheaven given to mankind by which we must be saved,\u201d makes it clear that\nsalvation is through Yeshua alone, for all\u2014 Jew ( first ) and Gentile (\nsecondary ) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BAAP RE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jews claim that the\nTorah contains some 613 commands which are summed up in the Ten Commandments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sacred Scriptures\nof Judaism consist of three groups of documents: the Law, the Prophets, and the\nWritings (such as Psalms and Proverbs). These Scriptures also form the Old\nTestament of the Christian Bible. Judaism does not accept the inspiration of\nthe New Testament or its account of the fulfillment of the Old Testament\nprophecies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism, does not\naccept the central Christian teaching that Jesus Christ is the Messiah foretold\nin the Old Testament.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jews drool when they\nsay-- Christianity has received from Judaism its basic understanding of God,\nhis covenant relationship with His people, and assembling together for worship.\nThere is a divine plan for history and it is moving toward a wonderful goal\nwhen Yahweh will be the King not only of the Jews but of all the earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because the consonantal\nHebrew text lacked punctuation, phrase breaks could be variously inserted. The\nHebrew of Isa 40:3 predicts the return to Israel of the exiles in Babylon: \u201cA\nvoice cries out: \u2018In the wilderness prepare the way of the Lord.\u2019\u201d The Gospel\nof Mark repunctuates this same passage to introduce John the Baptist: \u201cThe\nvoice of one crying out in the wilderness, \u2018Prepare the way of the Lord\u2019\u201d (Mark\n1:3).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Christian church\nunderstands Isaiah\u2019s \u201csuffering servant\u201d (Isa 53:5-7) to be Jesus (Acts 8:3-36,\nJohn 19:34-37). In the synagogue, traditionally, the servant is Israel (see Isa\n41:8, Isa 44:1, Isa 44:21, Isa 49:3); rabbinic sources also associate the\nservant with Moses, Rabbi Akiva, and a hidden Messiah who suffers from leprosy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism focuses on the Torah,\nwhich is read in its entirety in synagogues either annually or triennially.\nEach Torah reading is accompanied by a reading from the Prophets. Christian\nlectionaries focus on the Prophets, and the \u201cOld Testament\u201d selections are\naccompanied by New Testament readings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most churches, the\nBible is read in the vernacular; in the synagogue, it is chanted from the\nHebrew.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Etz Hayim, \"tree\nof life\" is a humash (a Torah in printed form) published and used by the\nConservative Jewish movement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna listen to a rabid\nRabbi ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the Etz Hayim''\nwas issued, more than 100,000 copies have been sold. &nbsp;Eventually, it is expected to become the\nstandard Bible in all Conservative synagogues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QYGWm8B0rUs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/QYGWm8B0rUs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rabbi&nbsp; Dr. David L. Lieber, was president emeritus\nof the University of Judaism (now known as the American Jewish University) &nbsp;and the senior editor of the Etz Hayim Humash.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lieber\nbaby first conceived of the idea of writing the Etz Hayim Humash in 1969, in\norder to create a \"new Torah commentary to reflect the age in which it is\nmade ..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Etz Hayim contains the Hebrew text of the Torah, the Jewish\nPublication Society (JPS)'s modern English translation of the Hebrew text, a\nnumber of commentaries, written in English, on the Torah which run alongside\nthe Hebrew text and its English translation and a number of essays on the Torah\nand Tanakh in the back of the book.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Etz Hayim contains three types of\ncommentary: the p'shat which discusses the literal meaning of the text, the\ndrash which draws on Talmudic, Medieval, Chassidic, and Modern Jewish sources\nto expound on the deeper meaning of the text, and the halacha l'maaseh which\nexplains how the text relates to current Jewish practice and halacha, or Jewish\nlaw.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The essays in the back cover a wide range of topics, from kashrut to\neschatology and everything in between.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism believes that\nthe Jewish Scriptures, often referred to as the Old Testament, are the inspired\nword of God. n 1 Chronicles 21:1, it states, \u201cThen Satan stood up against\nIsrael and moved David to number Israel.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, another\npassage in the Jewish Bible, 2 Samuel 24:1, states that God caused King David\nto count the Jewish people. \u201cThe anger of the Lord burned against Israel, and\nHe incited David against them to say, \u2018Go number Israel\u2026\u2019\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, who made David\nnumber Israel \u2013 Satan or God?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The New Testament\nstates, \u201cIf anyone comes to Me, and does not hate his own father and mother and\nwife and children and brothers and sisters, yes, and even his own life, he\ncannot be My disciple.\u201d [Luke 14:26]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we read this verse\nas an isolated passage, it appears to say that a person must hate his/her\nfamily in order to be considered a disciple of Jesus. However, this statement\nclearly contradicts the Old Testament biblical command to honor one\u2019s parents\nas found in the Ten Commandments. \u201cHonor your father and your mother\u2026\u201d [Exodus\n20:12] <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the book of Matthew\n2:23 where we are told that \u201cJesus came and resided in a city called Nazareth\nthat what was spoken through the prophets might be fulfilled, \u2018He shall be\ncalled a Nazarene.\u2019\u201d This statement does not appear anywhere in the Old\nTestament. In fact, at the time of the writing of the Old Testament, the city\nof Nazareth did not even exist!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Synoptic Gospels\nstate that the Last Supper was on Passover (Matthew 26:1-19, Mark 14:12-23 and\nLuke 22:7-20). However, the disciple John claims that Jesus was crucified\nbefore Passover started.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cNow it was the day of\npreparation for the Passover\u2026 and they crucified him.\u201d [John 19:14-18]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The New Testament has\nits own deuterocanon, as well, comprised of: Hebrews, 2nd Peter, 2nd and 3rd\nJohn, James, Jude, and Revelation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The New Testament protocanon includes the\nGospels, Acts, the Pauline epistles, 1st Peter, and 1st John, and the Old Testament\nprotocanon includes modern Protestant Old Testaments. In both cases, the\nprotocanon and deuterocanon are valued equally as the word of God..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apocrypha means\n\u201chidden,\u201d and is used to refer to anything which is non-canonical. As with the\nterm \u2018deuterocanon,\u2019 there is an entire New Testament apocrypha, but it\u2019s made\nup of very different books.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact, if you contrast the New Testament\ndeuterocanon (Hebrews, 2nd Peter, 2nd and 3rd John, James, Jude, and\nRevelation) with the New Testament apocrypha (the Gnostic \u201cGospels\u201d of Thomas\nand Judas, both Apocalypses of Peter, Infancy Gospel of James, etc.), you can\nsee the importance of the terminology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism accepts the Old\nTestament, but not the New Testament, but they do not refer to it as the\n\"Old Testament,\" but instead the \"Hebrew Bible\" or the\nTanakh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hebrew Bible is\ndivided into three parts, The Torah, the Writings (Ketuviym) and the Prophets\n(Navi'im). Note that the first letters of each of these Hebrew names are T-N-K,\nand this is where the word, more specifically the acronym, TaNaKh comes from.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hebrew names for\nthe first five books of the Torah are; Bereshiyt (in the beginning), Shemot\n(names), Vayiqra (and he called), Bemidbar (in the wilderness) and Devariym\n(words). These names of the books are the first principle word in each of the\nbooks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Torah is a part of\nthe \"Old Testament\" and is specifically the first five books of the\nOld Testament, Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Hebrew\nBible, there were a Canaanite tribe who inhabited Jerusalem prior to its\nconquest by Joshua (11:3 and 12:10) or King David (2 Samuel 5:6-10).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham, the youngest of\nthe Noah\u2019s three sons, had four sons: Cush, Mizraim (Hebrew for \u201cEgypt\u201d), Put,\nand Canaan (Genesis 10:6; 1 Chronicles 1:8).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Egypt was later called\nthe \u201cland of Ham\u201d (Psalm 78:51; 105:23; 106:22).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of Ham's four sons,\nCanaan fathered the Canaanites, while Mizraim fathered the Egyptians, Cush the\nCushites, and Phut the Libyans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Book\nof Genesis, after Noah became drunk and Ham dishonored his father, upon\nawakening Noah pronounced a curse on Ham's youngest son, Canaan, stating that\nhis offspring would be the \"servants of servants\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOAH SUDDENLY REALISED\nTHAT HIS GRANDSON WAS HIS OWN WIFEs SON.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CANAAN HIS GRANDSON\nSUDDENLY BECAME HIS SON.. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:20 And Noah began\nto be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:21 And he drank\nof the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:22 And Ham, the\nfather of Canaan, saw the NAKEDNESS OF HIS FATHER and told his two brethren\nwithout.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:23 And Shem and\nJapheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went\nbackward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were\nbackward, and they saw not their father\u2019s nakedness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:24 And Noah awoke\nfrom his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:25 And he said,\nCursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen 9:26 And he said,\nBlessed be the LORD God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS \u201cNAKEDNESS OF\nHIS FATHER \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT JUST MEANS HE\nSCREWED HIS OWN MOTHER <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014 INCEST!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New International\nVersion Genesis 5:32:- After Noah was 500 years old, he became the father of\nShem, Ham and Japheth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leviticus 20:11 (\nEnglish standard version ) And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath\nuncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death;\ntheir blood shall be upon them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New American Standard\nBible Leviticus 18:7:- 'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father,\nthat is, the nakedness of your mother. She is your mother; you are not to\nuncover her nakedness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">American Standard\nVersion Leviticus 20:11:-And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath\nuncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death;\ntheir blood shall be upon them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">English Standard\nVersion Leviticus 20:11:-If a man lies with his father\u2019s wife, he has uncovered\nhis father\u2019s nakedness; both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood\nis upon them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deuteronomy\n27:20:-'Cursed is he who lies with his father's wife, because he has uncovered\nhis father's skirt.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deuteronomy 20:27:-\nCursed be he that lieth with his father's wife; because he uncovereth his\nfather's skirt. And all the people shall say, Amen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the height of their\npower during this time, the Israelites made the Canaanites slaves rather than\nwiping them out. Perhaps the Israelites believed putting these people into\nforced labor was more beneficial than destroying them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moses warned the\nIsraelites not to adopt the sexual behaviour and practises of the Canaanites\nand other tribes within the Promised Land in Leviticus 18:6-18 and Exodus\n23:23-24.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historically, Jewish\npeople owned and traded slaves. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ancient Israelite\nsociety allowed slavery Slaves were seen as an essential part of a Hebrew\nhousehold. The Hebrew Bible contains two sets of rules governing slaves: one\nset for Hebrew slaves (Lev 25:39-43) and a second set for Canaanite slaves (Lev\n25:45-46)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARE THE CUNTS WHO\nACCUSE HINDUS OF ILL TREATING DALITS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The laws governing\nnon-Hebrew slaves were more harsh than those governing Hebrew slaves:\nnon-Hebrew slaves could be owned permanently, and bequeathed to the owner's children,\nwhereas Hebrew slaves were treated as servants, and were released after six\nyears of service or the occurrence of a jubilee year.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That the distinction\nwas due to the fact that non-Hebrew slaves were subject to the curse of Canaan,\nwhereas God did not want Jews to be SLAVES Most slaves owned by Israelites were\nnon-Hebrew, Israelites continued to own Hebrew slaves through the Middle Ages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Talmud (200\u2013500 AD\n) contains an extensive set of laws governing slavery, which is more detailed,\nand different from the original laws found in the Jewish Bible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the few rules\nthat distinguished between Jewish and non-Jewish slaves regarded found\nproperty: items found by Jewish slaves were owned by the slave, but items found\nby a non-Jewish slave belonged to the slave owner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another change was that\nthe Talmud explicitly prohibits the freeing of a non-Jewish slave, which was\nstricter that the biblical law which was silent on the issue, and simply\npermitted slaves to be owned indefinitely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Torah allows sex with\nnon-engaged slaves, by clarifying that if she is engaged when the master has\nsex with her, \"they are not to be put to death, since she was not\nfreed\" (which implies that a woman's slave status has direct bearing on\nwhether she can be used for sex). Biblical rules for treatment of Jewish slaves\nwere more lenient than for non-Jewish slaves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Talmudic laws\nrequired Jewish slave owners to try to convert non-Jewish slaves to Judaism.\nOther laws required slaves, if not converted, to be circumcised and undergo\nritual immersion in a bath (mikveh).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jewish slave owners\nwere not permitted to drink wine that had been touched by an uncircumcised\nperson so there was always a practical need, in addition to the legal\nrequirement, to circumcise slaves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the Middle Ages,\nJews acted as slave-traders in Slavonia North Africa, Baltic States, Central\nand Eastern Europe, Spain and Portugal, and Mallorca The most significant\nJewish involvement in the slave-trade was in Spain and Portugal during the 10th\nto 15th centuries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jews continued to own\nslaves during the 16th through 18th centuries, and ownership practices were\nstill governed by Talmudic laws.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is also the\nversion that has been handed down and remains in the modern Christian biblical\nstories and that Europeans, especially during the Atlantic slave trade used to\njustify African enslavement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/05/black-african-slave-trade-and-jews-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/05/black-african-slave-trade-and-jews-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">Hebrew and Yiddish are very dissimilar even though\nboth languages use the Hebrew alphabets in their scripts. While Hebrew is a\nSemitic language , Yiddish is a German dialect which uses many Hebrew words but\nwith a very distinctive Ashkenazic pronunciation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">MALAYALAM AND HEBREW ARE SIMILAR ( NOT SANSKRIT )\n..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">THE HERO OF ISRAEL SOLOMON HAD A NAMBOODIRI MOTHER (\nBATH SHEBA ) AND A THIYYA WIFE ( QUEEN OF SHEBA ).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">KING SOLOMONs SEAL ( 950 BC ) WAS IN MALAYALAM.&nbsp; HIS SHIPS WERE MADE IN CALICUT ( BEYPORE\n).&nbsp; HIS PALACE STAIRCASE WAS MADE OF\nWAYANAD SANDALWOOD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">SKEPTIC ????<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">YEH LEH ! ( THIS WILL BE NEWS TO CIA/ MOSSAD WHO THINK THEY KNOW EVERYTHING ABOUT JEWS )</span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">y'hud\u00ed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n</td></tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Queen of Sheba - an\nexotic and mysterious woman of power - is immortalised in the world's great\nreligious works, among them the Hebrew Bible and the Muslim Koran. She also\nappears in Turkish and Persian painting, in Kabbalistic treatises, and in\nmedieval Christian mystical works, where she is viewed as the embodiment of\nDivine Wisdom and a foreteller of the cult of the Holy Cross..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tales of\nSolomon and the Queen of Sheba have, provided the founding myths for the modern\nstate of Israel..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And when the Queen of\nSheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the LORD, she came to\nprove him with hard questions. And she came to Jerusalem with a very great\ntrain, with camels that bore spices, and very much gold, and precious stones:\nand when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her\nheart. And King Solomon gave unto the Queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever\nshe asked, beside that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she\nturned and went to her own country, she and her servants.(I Kings 10 v.1-13)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Book of Ezekiel (27\nv.22-24) tells us that the merchants trading with Tyre came from Sheba &nbsp;( MALABAR )&nbsp;\nand Raamah ( PUNT ) , and brought with them spices, precious stones and\ngold - the exact same goods that the Queen of Sheba brought with her when she\ncame to visit Solomon in Jerusalem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raamah or Rama is a\nname found in the Hebrew Bible ( \u05e8\u05e2\u05de\u05d4, Ra\u201bm\u00e2h), means \" holy land \u201c.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sheba overseas is the\nkingdom of DHOFAR which was owned and ruled by the Calicut king with a harbor Salalah\n( Oman ) where the king had a major spice depot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dedan is mentioned in\nthe Book of Ezekiel, (Chapters 27 and 38). Chapter 27 is a roster of the spice trading\npartners of the city of Tyre (today in modern Lebanon)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DHOFAR was also called\nthe kingdom of DEDAN / SHEBA ( overseas kingdom of the Calicut king with\nSalalah harbor &nbsp;)..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The king of Calicut had\na ship repair yard and spice depot at Basra ( Euphrates basin ) which is also\ncalled DEDAN.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Sheba, and Dedan,\nand the merchants of Tarshish, with all the young lions thereof, shall say unto\nthee, Art thou come to take a spoil? hast thou gathered thy company to take a\nprey? to carry away silver and gold, to take away cattle and goods, to take a\ngreat spoil?\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sons of Raamah;\nSheba, and Dedan &nbsp;(1 Chronicles 1:9).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sheba, and Dedan, and\nthe merchants of Tarshish, with all the young lions thereof, shall say to you,\nAre you come to take a spoil? have you gathered your company to take a prey? to\ncarry away silver and gold, to take away cattle and goods, to take a great\nspoil?-- Ezekiel 38:13<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sabeans or people\nof Saba or Sheba, are referred to as traders in gold and spices, and as\ninhabiting a country remote from Palestine (1 Kings 10:1 Isaiah 60:6 Jeremiah\n6:20 Ezekiel 27:22 Psalm 72:15 Matthew 12:42)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Solomon engaging\nin spice trade with a distant country called \u201cTharshish\u201d(1Kin 10:22).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And she gave the king a\nhundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and\nprecious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the\nqueen of Sheba gave to king Solomon. (Bible: 1 Kings 10:10)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the king had at sea\na navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram: once in three years came the navy\nof Tharshish, bringing spices, gold, silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks. (1\nKings 10:22)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moses was instructed in\nthe uses of fragrant cinnamon (Exodus 30:23) in the making of the anointing\noil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1 Kings (1Kings 10:22)\nnotes that King Solomon had \"a fleet of ships of Tarshish\" at sea\nwith the fleet of his ally King Hiram of Tyre.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE SHIPS OF KING\nSOLOMON WAS MADE OF TEAK IN A SHIPYARD CALLED BEYPORE ( CALICUT ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Psalm 72 (Ps 72:10),\n\"May the kings of Tarshish and of the coastlands render him tribute; may\nthe kings of Sheba and Seba bring gifts!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ezekiel 27:25 \"The\nships of Tarshish traveled for you with your merchandise. So you were filled\nand heavily laden in the heart of the seas.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jonah 1:3 (Jonah 1:3),\n4:2 mentions Tarshish as a distant place: \"But Jonah rose to flee to\nTarshish from the presence of the Lord. He went down to Joppa and found a ship\ngoing to Tarshish.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Tarshish\"&nbsp; is also known as meteorite Stone of the Tribe\nof Asher .. Ashers are Kerala sages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Tarshish has\n26 occurrences in 23 sections in the Holy Bible&nbsp;\n--a Sanskrit word, meaning \u201cthe sea coast\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Calicut king\nowned&nbsp; library and spice depot at Cordoba\n\u2013spices came from Tarshish . The original name of the Mediterranean sea is \u201cSea\nof Tarshish\u201d .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original name of Cordoba was &nbsp;Tarshish, the only place where Ayurvedic\nmedicinal herbs , spices and books of knowledge were available .. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jews being middlemen of spices infested this\nplace. A pilgrimage originated from the gates of this library.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jews celebrate --\nthe earliest known inscription in Ancient Hebrew is the Khirbet Qeiyafa\nInscription (11th century BCE).&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY JEWS \u2014IT IS NOT\nHEBREW\u2014AND THE PLACE ( 30 KM SW OF JERUSALEM \u2013ELAH VALLEY ) HAS NOTHING TO DO\nWITH KING DAVID.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NO AMOUNT OF FORGERY,\nPLANTING FAKE ARTIFACTS , REMOVING AND DESTROYING REAL ARTIFACTS WHICH DO NOT\nSUPPORT THE KOSHER STORY - CAN MAKE YOUR REVERSE ENGINEERING SUCCEED. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS WAS A HINDU\nSETTLEMENT MUCH BEFORE JUDAISM OR HEBREW WERE CREATED BY SEMITES FROM KERALA..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Worshipping standing\nstones (matzevot) seems to have been a pagan Canaanite custom and Jews were\ncommanded to destroy them (Exodus 34:13).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balls to the conmen\nProf. Yosef Garfinkel, the Yigal Yadin Professor of Archaeology at the\nInstitute of Archaeology at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the Hebrew\nBible, which in Christianity is known as the \"Old Testament\", is\ncommonly known in Judaism as the \"Tanakh\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These texts are\ncomposed mainly in Biblical Hebrew, with some passages in Biblical Aramaic (in\nthe books of Daniel, Ezra and a few others).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism has never\naccepted any of the claimed fulfillments of prophecy that Christianity\nattributes to Jesus. Judaism also forbids the worship of a person as a form of\nidolatry, since the central belief of Judaism is the absolute unity and\nsingularity of God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Traditional views of\nJesus has declared &nbsp;Jesus as an impostor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The belief that Jesus\nis God, the Son of God, or a person of the Trinity, is incompatible with Jewish\ntheology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE JEWS ARE MERELY\nEXCITED BECAUSE JESUS WAS CONSIDERED A JEW.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism rejects Jesus\nas God, Divine Being, intermediary between humans and God, messiah or holy.\nBelief in the Trinity is held to be incompatible with Judaism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Judaic\nbeliefs, the Torah rules out a trinitarian God in Deuteronomy (6:4): \"Hear\nIsrael, the Lord is our God, the Lord is one.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism teaches that it\nis heretical for any man to claim to be God, part of God, or the literal son of\nGod. The Jerusalem Talmud (Ta'anit 2:1) states explicitly: \"if a man\nclaims to be God, he is a liar.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To the question, Was\nJesus God or man?, the Christians therefore answered: both. This made a\ncomplete breach with Judaism inevitable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the 12th century, Maimonides\ncodified core principles of Modern Judaism, writing \"[God], the Cause of\nall, is one. This does not mean one as in one of a pair, nor one like a species\n(which encompasses many individuals), nor one as in an object that is made up\nof many elements, nor as a single simple object that is infinitely divisible.\nRather, God is a unity unlike any other possible unity.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maimonides' thirteen\nprinciples of faith includes the concept that God has no body and that physical\nconcepts do not apply to Him..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the\n\"Yigdal\" prayer, found towards the beginning of the Jewish prayer\nbooks used in synagogues around the world, it states \"He has no semblance\nof a body nor is He corporeal\". It is a central tenet of Judaism that God\ndoes not have any physical characteristics; that God's essence cannot be\nfathomed..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judaism does not share\nthe Christian concept of salvation, as it does not believe people are born in a\n\"state of sin\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Saint\nPeter ( who never existed ) the Apostle in Acts 4:12, Jesus Christ God is the\nunique way of truth and door of salvation, since \"neither is there\nsalvation in any other: for there is none other name under Heaven given among\nmen whereby we must be saved.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Church of Jesus\nChrist of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church-Mormons ) defines the term salvation\nbased on the teachings of their prophet Joseph Smith, as recorded in the\nDoctrine and Covenants.. Mormonism is Jew Rothschild\u2019s religion. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The padres can FUCK FUCK FUCK..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/07/mormons-bankrolled-by-rothschild-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/07/mormons-bankrolled-by-rothschild-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are more than\n20,000 Mormons in India\u2014they don\u2019t love the watan. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nowhere in the written\nrecord of ancient Egypt is there any explicit mention of Hebrew or Israelite\nslaves.&nbsp; The Torah states that 600,000\nmen between the ages of twenty and sixty left Egypt; adding women, children,\nand the elderly, we arrive at a population in the vicinity of two million souls\nsurviving on manna. 18:5), is in the neighborhood of Horeb; if the locality Massah and Meribah (17:7) is to be found in the region of Kadesh-Barnea or is identical with it (Num. 20:1\u201314, 24; Ezek. 47:19), then this battle was waged in the northern part of the Sinai Peninsula.&nbsp;</span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-42rDKl_OpV8/VTqmgoBEqUI/AAAAAAAA4FE/gJUFKnm3Mek/s1600/imarges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The Book of Exodus relates that Joshua fought against Amalek under the inspiration of Moses, who was supported by Aaron and Hur, and that he mowed them down with the sword. Amalek was not destroyed, however, and at the end of this war Moses was ordered to write in a document, as a reminder, that the Lord would one day blot out the memory of Amalek from under the heaven.</span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"366\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-l0R-SVDz9OY/VTqlu1d6azI/AAAAAAAA4E0/0fkCcVLh6bU/s1600/6a0120a610bec4970c0168ea9se2085970c.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;In commemoration of the victory, Moses built an altar which he called \"YHWH-Nissi,\" and proclaimed that \"The Eternal will be at war against Amalek throughout the ages.\" This implies that Israel is commanded to wage a holy war of extermination against Amalek (Deut. 25:12\u201319), for in the early days \"the wars of Israel\" and the \"wars of the Lord\" were synonymous expressions (cf., e.g., Judg. 5:23).<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><i><b>Below: Battle of Joshua with Amalekites !</b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; clear: both; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The ADL for long denied the Armenian genocide, because sooner than later the whole world will know that &nbsp;Mustafa Kemal Ataturk was a Jew and NOT a Muslim.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
