Some modern versions still\nuse this name; others have reverted to Yahweh.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Isaiah 14:15 the\nHebrew word for a grave (Sheol) was translated as Hell \u2014 suggesting that the\nancient Jews had a concept of an afterlife and eternal punishment.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Isaiah 14:15 (KJV) Yet\nthou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the pit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The translators of the\nAuthorised Version did their best to paper over the cracks in the original\ntexts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a &nbsp;contradiction\nconcerning a woman called Michal, a daughter of Saul. According to 2 Samuel\n6:23 she remained childless until her death, but according to 2 Samuel 21:8 she\nhad five sons. The Authorised Version disguised this contradiction by implying\nthat she merely brought up these sons for someone else (Adriel). More modern\nversions of the Bible prefer a method used by a few early manuscripts and\nreplace the name Michal by the name Merab in one of the stories. (The NIV\nadmits the truth in a footnote; the Jerusalem Bible keeps quiet about it.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-v3NBDSkFAmc/XDXXJsQAzrI/AAAAAAABfVg/mUoO6UNyGdcENSMvzO_jMoj3NZ5N84NSQCLcBGAs/s1600/Ds%2B%2526%2BG.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"373\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-v3NBDSkFAmc/XDXXJsQAzrI/AAAAAAABfVg/mUoO6UNyGdcENSMvzO_jMoj3NZ5N84NSQCLcBGAs/s640/Ds%2B%2526%2BG.jpg\" width=\"596\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>JEW DAVID DID NOT KILL\nGOLIATH.. &nbsp;MIDGET DAVID ( 5 FEET ONE INCH\n) WAS TOO MUCH OF A SLY&nbsp; DECEITFUL COWARD<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>A HINDU ELHANAN KILLED\nGOLIATH</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-djHKfV6tY0Y/XDYcLc-P-wI/AAAAAAABfV4/ECReLqzHPSMBaF7UGB4H9K0LvGX6pnVTQCLcBGAs/s1600/uDDuuz8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"478\" data-original-width=\"330\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-djHKfV6tY0Y/XDYcLc-P-wI/AAAAAAABfV4/ECReLqzHPSMBaF7UGB4H9K0LvGX6pnVTQCLcBGAs/s400/uDDuuz8.jpg\" width=\"275\" /></a></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>..</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The truth appears in 2\nSamuel 21:19, where Elhanan&nbsp; son of Jaareoregim\nthe Beth-lehemite is &nbsp;credited with\nkilling Goliath Gittite -- the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver\u2019s beam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elhanan killed Goliath\neven before David was born.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;First Samuel 17:4 notes that Goliath\u2019s height\nwas measured at \u201csix cubits and one span,\u201d about nine feet, six inches. The\nSeptuagint has the height of Goliath at four cubits and one span, or about six\nfeet, six inches. The Dead sea scrolls has the height at six feet nine inches.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The killing of Goliath\na major factor in David being chosen as a future king.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First Samuel 17:50\nstates that David cut off Goliath's head with the giant's own sword, after he had\nfirst felled him with a sling and a stone. After he killed him, he cut off his\nhead with the sword. When the Philistines saw that their hero was dead, they\nturned and ran.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of this amazing\nvictory over the Philistine, David became the foremost battle-champion among\nthe Israelite troops, even though he was still a mere weakling midget teenager.\nThe slaying of Goliath was by Elhanan but later attributed to David to increase\nhis fame.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original biblical\ntexts contained errors of various sorts, but further errors have been\nintroduced by translators. Sometimes these errors are deliberate interpolations\nby translators, performed to tidy up inconvenient .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before 325 AD , the New\nTestament did not exist and authority was believed to reside in the Septuagint\nand in Jesus\" sayings, which circulated orally. At one time both Jews and\nChristians regarded the Septuagint as divinely inspired, but in the course of\ntime many errors were revealed, and the Jews adopted better translations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nEastern Church retained its attachment to the Septuagint, while the Western\nChurch adopted a Latin translation instead. The Septuagint was then virtually\nabandoned within Western Europe. For many centuries the Greek version was\nregarded there as no more than the book belonging to schismatic Eastern\nChurches.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although the Bible was\noriginally written mainly in Hebrew and Greek, the Western Church ceded primacy\nto its own translation. St Jerome translated (most of) the Bible into Latin\nprobably between 384 and 404, based on Hebrew and Greek texts, along with\nearlier Latin translations. His version is the known as Vulgate, so called\nbecause it was written as a new vulgar (i.e. common) edition. At the time it\nwas controversial.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There were riots over some of Jerome's translations, which\nwere held to amount to tampering with established traditions. In time it became\nestablished not merely as authoritative, but divinely inspired. In 1546 the\nCouncil of Trent pronounced the Vulgate to be the only authentic Latin text. It\nis still considered authoritative on questions of faith and morals by the Roman\nCatholic Church. How widely it differs from modern translations (such as the\nJerusalem Bible) may be seen by the dual numbering system adopted in the\nJerusalem Bible<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to 1 Samuel\n13:1 Saul reigned for one year, but the text then goes on to talk about when he\nhad reigned for two years. The Authorised Version tried to gloss over the\nproblem by some judicious punctuation: \"Saul reigned for one year; and\nwhen he had reigned for two years over Israel ...\". The NIV abandons the\nHebrew in favour of a few late manuscripts of the Septuagint giving a different\naccount: \"Saul was <thirty> years old when he became king, and he\nreigned over Israel for <forty-> two years\". The Jerusalem Bible\navoids the problem by simply missing out the first verse altogether and\nstarting at verse 2.<o:p></o:p></forty-></thirty></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Translations have\nalways been angled to suit the views of the translators, and not always for\ndoctrinal reasons. As we have just seen, flexibility in translation can justify\nactivities like witch-hunting. But there have been many other motivations, for\nexample to confirm that kings are divinely appointed. Traditional Christian\nanti-Semitism has also been accommodated, for example by minimising the\nJewishness of important biblical characters. Speaking of his German translation\nof the Bible Martin Luther said \"I endeavoured to make Moses Jewish &nbsp;German \u201c <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/03/protestant-christianity-created-by-jews.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/03/protestant-christianity-created-by-jews.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3l_XSspUygM/XDXcWA03QLI/AAAAAAABfVo/fsnwmI6uAuwfJP5jQA7UjMFSyjedP_l6QCLcBGAs/s1600/s.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"658\" data-original-width=\"864\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3l_XSspUygM/XDXcWA03QLI/AAAAAAABfVo/fsnwmI6uAuwfJP5jQA7UjMFSyjedP_l6QCLcBGAs/s1600/s.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At least one biblical\nwriter found it necessary to assure readers that Jahveh and El Shaddai were the\nsame god: in Exodus 6:2-3 God explains that he had not used the name Jahveh in\nearlier times. It is more than likely that Jahveh and El Shaddai were originally\nseparate gods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">El Shaddai is one of\nthe names of the God of Israel. El Shaddai is conventionally translated as God\nAlmighty..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The name appears 48\ntimes in the Bible, seven times as \"El Shaddai\" (five times in\nGenesis, once in Exodus, and once in Ezekiel).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first occurrence of\nthe name is in Genesis 17:1, \"And when Abram was ninety years old and\nnine, the LORD appeared to Abram, and said unto him, I am El Shaddai; walk\nbefore me, and be thou perfect.\" Similarly, in Genesis 35:11 God says to\nJacob, \"I am El Shaddai: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company\nof nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Exodus 6:2\u20133, Shaddai was the name by which God was known to\nAbraham, Isaac, and Jacob.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Septuagint &nbsp;El Shaddai was often translated just as\n\"God\" or \"my God\".. In other places (such as Job 5:17) it\nis translated \"Almighty\" and &nbsp;this word is used in other translations as\nwell (such as the King James Bible).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Abraham, the\ngrand-father of Jacob, was worshipping a God by name El-Shaddai, a mountain-God\n( Shiva of Kailash Parvat ) along with his symbol, the linga pillar.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient\nDanavas of Kerala called Muthappan or Sheddaippan .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/10/muthappan-deity-of-north-kerala-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/10/muthappan-deity-of-north-kerala-capt.html</a><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Greek of the\nSeptuagint translation of Psalm 91.1, \"Shaddai\" is translated as\n\"the god of heaven\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shedai comes from\nShadod ( destroyer )..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The root word\n\"shadad\" (\u05e9\u05d3\u05d3) means to make desolate. This would give Shaddai the\nmeaning of \"destroyer\", representing one of the aspects of God, and\nin this context it is essentially an epithet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even today all orthodox\nJews have the Shedai on their doors \u2013a cylindrical box ( Mezuzah / Taviz with a tiny piece of Shiva Lingam inside )&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UArUdUVMi3w/XDXht_OJrdI/AAAAAAABfVw/O-zzpUSkLoAodstN9ECgWhW6_ZCLDREHACLcBGAs/s1600/iemages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UArUdUVMi3w/XDXht_OJrdI/AAAAAAABfVw/O-zzpUSkLoAodstN9ECgWhW6_ZCLDREHACLcBGAs/s400/iemages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are a couple\nverses in the Bible where there seems to be word play with \"Shadday\"\nand this root meaning to destroy (the day of Yhwh will come as destruction from\nShadday,&nbsp; Is. 13:6 and Joel 1:15<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Terah, the Hindu &nbsp;father of Abraham was a manufacturer of idols\nand linga pillars.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Terah is mentioned in\nthe Hebrew Bible (Genesis 11:26-27, Joshua 24:2 and 1 Chronicles 1:17\u201327) and\nNew Testament.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his final speech to\nthe Israelite leaders assembled at Shechem, Joshua recounts the history of\nGod's formation of the Israelite nation, beginning with \"Terah the father\nof Abraham \u201c..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/07/brahma-and-sarawati-abraham-and-sara.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/07/brahma-and-sarawati-abraham-and-sara.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abraham was the gem of\nthe chronology of Genesis 11 which the Torah wanted to focus on. In the Jewish\ntradition, Genesis (11:26) teaches that Terah was 70 years old when he begat\nAbram.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">According\nto rabbinical tradition Terah manufactured idols and stone lingams . In Jewish\ntradition, when Terah died at age 205, Abraham (70 years younger) was already\n135 years old</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Terah is mentioned in\nJesus\u2019 genealogy in Luke 3:34.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God promised to make\nAbram into a great nation (Genesis 12:1\u20132), even though Abram\u2019s wife, Sarai,\nwas barren (Genesis 11:30). Abraham heeded God\u2019s command and put His trust in\nthe Lord to the end of his days.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Years later, Joshua mentions Terah in an\naddress to the Israelites: \u201cThis is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:\n\u2018Long ago your ancestors, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor,\nlived beyond the Euphrates River and worshiped other gods\u2019\u201d (Joshua 24:2).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Joshua then urged the people to make a clean break from their pagan ( HINDU ) &nbsp;heritage: \u201cThrow away the gods your ancestors\n[including Terah] worshiped beyond the Euphrates River . . . and serve the\nLord\u201d (verse 14).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The worship of\nEl-Shaddai continued until the name was replaced by Moses by the name of 'Y H W\nH' rendered in English as Jehovah.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fikUVErM3UE/XDYcgvX96zI/AAAAAAABfWA/M4bWp93LFLsbkBNTIiztosCH1nJDgStmQCLcBGAs/s1600/73aDD4c59c2185517c23ccb34b1660683d--easter-eggs-grumpy-cat.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"236\" data-original-width=\"236\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fikUVErM3UE/XDYcgvX96zI/AAAAAAABfWA/M4bWp93LFLsbkBNTIiztosCH1nJDgStmQCLcBGAs/s400/73aDD4c59c2185517c23ccb34b1660683d--easter-eggs-grumpy-cat.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0112ostre is the pagan\ngoddess of dawn and promodial light.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Easter is named after\nthis Goddess Savitur.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Easter was never about\nJesus. &nbsp;Easter is celebrating the\nresurrection of Jesus from the dead, described in the New Testament as having\noccurred on the third day of his burial after his crucifixion by the Romans at\nCalvary c. 30 AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Easter is an ancient\nHindu festival millenniums before Judaism was born.&nbsp; Easter was originally a celebration of\nEostre.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindu lunisolar\ncalendar whose date indicates both the moon phase and the time of the solar\nyear. If the solar year is defined as a tropical year, then a lunisolar\ncalendar will give an indication of the season; if it is taken as a sidereal\nyear, then the calendar will predict the constellation near which the full moon\nmay occur. As with all calendars which divide the year into months there is an\nadditional requirement that the year have a whole number of months.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The luni-solar calendar\nis &nbsp;based on the lunar cycle, for which\nalternate months of 29 and 30 days, re-united in periods of 19 years (cycle of\nMetone), that they comprise 12 years of 12 months (common year)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Christian Easter is\nSunday that follows the 1\u00b0 plenilune that one verification after the of spring\nequinox, and is inclusive between March 22 and April 25. Such rule has stayed\nestablished from the Council of Nicea (325).&nbsp;\nThe First Council of Nicaea (325) established worldwide uniformity, &nbsp;for Easter explicitly laid down by the\nCouncil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Encyclopedia\nBritannica clearly explains the pagan traditions associated with the egg<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hiranyagarbha means\n\"golden fetus\" or \"golden womb\". &nbsp;Brahmanda is the cosmic egg.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tradition of the\nTsar giving his Empress a surprise Easter egg by Carl Faberg\u00e9 started around\n1885, when Tsar Alexander III commissioned the House of Faberg\u00e9 to make an\nEaster egg as a gift for his wife, the Empress Maria Fedorovna.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AND NOW WE HAVE\nPAGALIKA GHOSE COLLECTING EASTER EGGS ON GOOD FRIDAY.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original text of\nPsalm 110:3 refers to the womb of the goddess of the dawn, but it is not\nacceptable to mention that the Jews recognised other deities, so the Authorised\nVersion speaks evasively of the womb of the morning.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capital letters are\nimportant weapons in the armoury of orthodox Christian translators. By\ncapitalising certain words they can be made into names, and by capitalising\nphrases it is possible to make them into titles. Thus in the New Testament\nJesus is given the title of Son of man, but when the same phrase occurs in the\nOld Testament referring to someone else (as it is throughout the book of\nEzekiel) it is more convenient to render it without capitals as the son of man,\nso that it is not a title at all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Careful translation\nalso avoids the embarrassment to Christians of referring to people other than\nJesus as Christ. In fact many individuals are referred to in the Old Testament\nas Christ (Hebrew messiah, English \"anointed\").&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When applied to Jesus\nin the New Testament the word is always used as a title, but when it is used of\nkings and high priests in the Old Testament it is rendered as \"the anointed\"\n(see for example Leviticus 4:5, 4:16 and 6:22). Psalm 105:15 should really be\ntranslated as \"Touch not my christs\" , which does not sound right to\northodox Christian ears. In almost all translations of Isaiah 45:1, God refers\nto Cyrus the Great as his anointed, rather than as his Christ, which is just as\ncorrect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God created both man\nand woman on the sixth day (Genesis 1:27), having already created the plants\nand animals. But later, after the seventh day, he formed Adam from the dust of\nthe ground (Genesis2:7), then the plants and animals again, then Eve.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In the\nseventeenth century scholars noted the inconsistencies and deduced that there\nhad been two creations, first of the gentiles then of the Jews. Scholars in the\nnext century realised that the story is composed of two separate accounts,\nalthough it took 200 years for this realisation to gain general acceptance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nis now widely accepted to be correct, and biblical scholars concur that the\nfirst account was written by the Priestly (P) source and the second by the\nYahwist (J) source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the story of the\nflood is a conflation of two versions of the Babylonian story of Gilgamesh, one\nP, and the other J. In the P version, only one male and one female of each\nspecies is saved (Genesis 6:19-20), whereas in the J version, seven (or seven\npairs) of each clean animal species and one pair of unclean animal species are\nsaved (Genesis 7:2-3).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enemies of the Jews were\nincredibly tenacious, to cement the propaganda that Jews are extremely brave and no pushovers..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Edomites rebelled (2 Kings 8:22) after every male of\nthat race had been killed (1 Kings 11:16). The Midianites were even more\nimpressive. With all their males killed and females captured (Numbers 31:7-9)\nthey somehow managed to defeat the Israelites (Judges 6:1-5).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Amalekites,\nhaving been utterly destroyed by Saul (1 Samuel 15:7-20), rose up against\nDavid, who left neither man nor woman alive amongst them (1 Samuel 27:9), after\nwhich they attacked him yet again (1 Samuel 30:1-17).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are conflicting\nversions of what happened when the Assyrian Sennacherib demanded increased\ntribute from Hezekiah. According to 2 Kings 18:14-16 Hezekiah simply pays up.\nBut, in the subsequent passage, 2 Kings 18:17-19:37, he appears to defy\nSennacherib.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The angel of the Lord then appears and kills 185,000 of\nSennacherib's men during the night so that Sennacherib is obliged to return\nhome defeated. In one place the Old Testament says that Aaron died at Mosera\n(Deuteronomy 10:6) but in another that he died on Mount Hor (Numbers 20:27-8).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God himself is not\nalways consistent. The modern Ten Commandments say that God will visit the\niniquity of the fathers upon the children (Exodus 20:5 and Deuteronomy 5:9),\nbut Ezekiel 18:20 says that the son shall not bear the iniquity of the father<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Old Testament makes\nassumptions about the nature of the world that are now realised to be false.\nFor example frequent references are made to the waters under Earth \u2014 waters\nthat many ancient peoples believed in and that gods could use to flood the world\n(cf. Genesis 7:11) but are now known not to exist.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again we know today that\nstars do not sing (Job 38:7), that Earth does not have edges or corners (Job\n38:13, Psalm 2:8, Ezekiel 7:2), and that snow and hail are not kept in\nstorehouses (Job 38:22). The Bible also makes factual errors on subjects like\ngeography, history and etymology , and assumes the efficacy of traditional folk\nmagic (e.g. Genesis 30:37-43).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accounts of the\ncreation of the world are clearly incompatible with what is now known about\ncosmology and geology. The story of the creation of Adam and Eve does not\nsquare with archaeological or evolutionary evidence. The animal species known\nto science, which include over 4,600 species of mammals alone, could not fit\ninto Noah's ark, whose dimensions are given in the biblical story.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Errors\nrevealed by science could fill a book; indeed such errors did fill many books\nin the nineteenth century when many Christians still believed in the literal\ntruth of the Bible. Biblical arithmetic is not too reliable either. In Ezra 2 a\nlist is given the total of which is stated to be 42,360 but which is really\n29,818. Nehemiah 7 gives essentially the same list, but with some changes. This\ntime the total is 31,089, though it is still stated to be 42,360.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_8.html?showComment=1547121703927#c9221098634391331837\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 10, 2019 at 5:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/god-code-by-timothy-paul-smith-damning.html<br />\n<br />\nSOMEBODY CALLED ME AND SAID-- YOU HAVE WRITTEN A BOOK BY THE ABOVE POST , AND STILL YOU SAY THAT YOU HAVE REVEALED ONLY 2%.<br />\n<br />\nCAN YOU KINDLY MAKE IT 2.01 %..<br />\n<br />\nWOKAY !<br />\n<br />\n###############################<br />\nHindu Jeroboam son of Nebat ( died 901 BC ) ruled North Israel for 22 years.. The Hindu wife Ano of Jeroboam is a character in the Hebrew Bible . She is mentioned in 1 Kings 14.<br />\n<br />\nSolomon tried to kill Jeroboam a Hindu Ephraimite, as he was more popular than his own son Rehoboam..<br />\n<br />\nJeroboam met the prophet Ahijah, the Shilonite who forecast that he would become the King of the northern ten of the tribes of Israel. Solomon heard of this prophesy and \" sought to kill \"<br />\n<br />\nJeroboam who was forced to flee to Egypt to the household of the Egyptian Hindu King, Shishak. There he remained until the death of Solomon. I Kings 11:26-41.<br />\n<br />\nThe relationship between Jeroboam and Shishak was a close one and they became not only allies, but Shishak gave in marriage to Jeroboam, Ano, the eldest sister of his own wife Thelkemina. Septuagint: Reges III, 12-24e.<br />\n<br />\nJew Rehoboam reigned in Jerusalem for seventeen years, but \u201che did evil because he had not set his heart on seeking the Lord\u201d (2 Chronicles 12:14).<br />\n<br />\nRehoboam and Jeroboam were both kings reigning in Israel\u2019s divided kingdom.<br />\n<br />\nRehoboam was one of Solomon\u2019s sons and king of Judah in the south (1 Kings 11:43). JEW Rehoboam\u2019s mother ( wife of Solomon ) , Naamah was a Hindu.. The Bible does not mention any other sons or daughters of Solomon<br />\nJeroboam was one of Solomon\u2019s former officials, an Ephraimite, and king of Israel in the north (1 Kings 11:26).<br />\n1 Kings 11: 29 \u2013 39 The prophet Abijah tell Jeroboam that he will be the king of Israel.<br />\n1 Kings 11: 40 Jeroboam escapes to Egypt to save his life from King Solomon.<br />\n1 Kings 12: 15 \u2013 16 Jeroboam returns to Israel after King Solomon dies.<br />\n<br />\nJeroboam reigned over the ten tribes of Israel for twenty-two years and was succeeded by his Hindu son Nadab. But then Nadab was murdered after two years on the throne, and the assassin killed all of Jeroboam\u2019s family, fulfilling Ahijah\u2019s prophecy (1 Kings 15:25\u201330).<br />\n<br />\nThe schism that occurred during the days of JEW Rehoboam and HINDU Jeroboam was the end of a united Israel. This division continued during their reigns: \u201cThere was continual warfare between Rehoboam and Jeroboam\u201d (2 Chronicles 12:15) and for centuries afterward.<br />\n<br />\nRehobaum had built a system of great fortifications and had wanted to attack Jeroboam in the north but the prophet Shemaiah warned against it. It was at this point that Shishak the ally of Jeroboam, attacked from the south with a massive army consisting of 1,200 chariots, 60,000 horsemen, and\" people without number that came with him out of Egypt: the Lubim, the Sukkiim, and the Ethiopians.\" II Chron. 12:2-3.<br />\n<br />\nIT IS A LIE THAT HINDUS OF PALESTINE SACRIFICED RAMS OR BULLS..<br />\n<br />\n1 Kings 12: 25 \u2013 33 Jeroboam starts the Golden Calf Cult . THIS IS A LIE..<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS SOLOMONs SON REHOBOAM WHO RE-STARTED GOLDEN CALF CULT TO GRAB POWER..<br />\n<br />\nGolden Calf was nothing but NANDI.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/01/nandi-bull-vahana-and-gatekeeper-of.html<br />\n<br />\nJEW REHOBOAM DESPITE BEING SOLOMONs SON WAS HATED BY JEWS. HE WAS ALL THE TIME WORRIED THAT JEWISH PEOPLE WOULD SHIFT LOYALTIES TO HINDU JEROBOAM.<br />\n<br />\nSO THE CLEVER JEWS DID A SLIMY EXCHANGE . HOW CAN JEWS LOVE A HINDU ( PAGAN ) KING ?<br />\n<br />\nKOSHER LIE NAILED: Once established in the northern kingdom, King Jeroboam feared that, if the people traveled to the temple in Jerusalem to worship, they would return to Rehoboam. So he set up centers of worship in Bethel and Dan, building golden calves and telling the people, \u201cIt is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Here are your gods, Israel, who brought you up out of Egypt\u201d (1 Kings 12:28).<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c9221098634391331837-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c9221098634391331837-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2778975519675082238\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. The Israelites feared that he would not return and demanded that Aaron make them \"gods\" to go before them (Exodus 32:1). Aaron gathered up the Israelites' golden earrings and ornaments, constructed a \"molten calf\" and they declared: \"These [be] thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.\" (Exodus 32:4)</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Aaron built an altar before the calf and proclaimed the next day to be a feast to the LORD. So they rose up early the next day and \"offered burnt-offerings, and brought peace-offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.\" (Exodus 32:6) God told Moses what the Israelites were up to back in camp, that they had turned aside quickly out of the way which God commanded them and he was going to destroy them and start a new people from Moses. Moses besought and pleaded that they should be spared (Exodus 32:11-14), and God \"repented of the evil which He said He would do unto His people.\"</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Moses went down from the mountain, but upon seeing the calf, he became angry and threw down the two Tablets of Stone, breaking them. Moses burnt the golden calf in a fire, ground it to powder, scattered it on water, and forced the Israelites to drink it. When Moses asked him, Aaron admitted collecting the gold, and throwing it into the fire, and said it came out as a calf (Exodus 32:21-24).UNQUOTE</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Rehobaum had built a system of great fortifications and had wanted to attack Jeroboam in the north but the prophet Shemaiah warned against it. It was at this point that Shishak the ally of Jeroboam, attacked from the south with a massive army consisting of 1,200 chariots, 60,000 horsemen, and\" people without number that came with him out of Egypt: the Lubim, the Sukkiim, and the Ethiopians.\" II Chron. 12:2-3.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">DAVIS IS REFERRED TO BY ZIONIST JEWS AS AN EPITOME AND EXAMPLE OF RIGHTEOUSNESS \u2013WHEN IN REALITY HE WAS A MEAN SON OF A BITCH..&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: 700;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">JEW DAVID GOT HINDU URAIH HIS BEST FRIEND MURDERED\u2014THE MAN WHO MADE HIM KING.. THE WHOLE IDEA WAS TO STEAL URAIHs WIFE THE BEAUTIFUL KERALA HINDU NAMBOODIRI WOMAN BATH SHEBA, WHO HE SAW NAKED ..WHEN URAIH WAS STILL ALIVE ( SENT AWAY BY DAVID TO A FAR OFF LAND )&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: 700;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: bold;\">DAVID HAD RAPED A DRUGGED BATH SHEBA AND MADE HER PREGNANT. LATER DAVID FORCED BATH SHEBA TO MARRY HIM.</span></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: bold;\">DAVID THE MAN OF POOR CHARACTER USURPED THE STORY OF KILLING OF GOLIATH TO HIS OWN ADVANTAGE. THIS FELLOW IS THE ROLE MODEL OF ZIONISTS OF ISRAEL.</span></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: bold;\">DAVID HAS SAUL AND HIS SON JONATHAN KILLED SO THAT HE CAN GRAB THE THRONE. SAUL DID NOT COMMIT SUICIDE..&nbsp;</span><div>\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: bold;\">MIND YOU , SAUL MADE DAVID THE COMMANDER OF HIS ARMY AND GAVE HIM A ROOM IN HIS OWN PLACE.. SUCH WAS DAVIDs GRATITUDE..</span><div>\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-weight: bold;\">SAUL HAD TOLD THAT HE WOULD GIVE HIS DAUGHTER MICHAL TO THE MAN WHO KILLED GOLIATH.. AND DAVID LIED THAT HE KILLED GOLIATH WHILE IN REALITY A HINDU ELHANAN KILLED GOLIATH.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Second Samuel 1:10 relates than an agent of David killed Saul. He came back to David with news of the murder and placed Saul\u2019s golden crown on his head and wrapped the royal arm band on David\u2019s arm ( for a reward ). Every thing is fudged to show EVIL David as a knight in shining armour. (2 Samuel 1:6\u201310).</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">CONTINUED TO 2--</span><br />\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"c2778975519675082238-ce\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c3571172516512285698\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_8.html?showComment=1547121814926#c3571172516512285698\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 10, 2019 at 5:33 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2--<br />\n<br />\nHERE IS THE DOCTORED KOSHER LIE -- Instead of the bonanza he was anticipating, the Amalekite received judgment. \u201cDavid called one of his men and said, \u2018Go, strike him down!\u2019 So he struck him down, and he died. For David had said to him, \u2018Your blood be on your own head. Your own mouth testified against you when you said, \u2018I killed the Lord\u2019s anointed\u2019\u201d (2 Samuel 1:15\u201316).<br />\n<br />\nHINDU SAUL WAS CREMATED \u2013NOT BURIED.<br />\n<br />\nMen of Jabesh Gilead travel overnight and take Saul\u2019s body and those of his sons and burn them at Jabesh (1 Samuel 31:11\u201312).<br />\n<br />\nKOSHER LIE: David becomes king and honors the brave men who buried Saul\u2019s body (2 Samuel 2:4\u20137).<br />\n<br />\nEvery passage in Samuel referring to David has him killing various people- like the the guy who put Saul out of his misery at Saul\u2019s own request. When I hear that David was a man after God\u2019s own heart that scares the heck out of me.<br />\n<br />\nAhijah the oracle predicted that all of Jeroboam\u2019s HINDU posterity would be slain and none would receive a proper CREMATION l except his son \u201cbecause in him there is found some good thing toward the Lord\u201d (1 Kings 14:13).<br />\n<br />\nAmong early nations it was the custom to erect altars on hilltops (Gen. 12:7\u20138; 22:2\u20134; 31:54).<br />\n<br />\nThere were many Ayyappa temples in Palestine.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the settlement in Canaan heathen altars were found set up on various hills and were ordered to be destroyed (Num. 33:52; Deut. 12:2\u20133). Altars to Jehovah were built at several high places (Judg. 6:25\u201326; 1 Sam. 9:12\u201325; 10:5, 13; 1 Chr. 21:26; 1 Kgs. 3:2\u20134; 18:30). Such altars became local centers of the worship of Jehovah.<br />\n<br />\nHindu Shishak ( a mentor of intellectuals ) was the king of Egypt who founded Egypt\u2019s XXIInd Dynasty as the Pharaoh Sheshong I. He reigned for 21 years c. 945\u2013924 B.C. He harboured Jeroboam as a fugitive from Solomon, after Ahijah\u2019s prophecy of Jeroboam\u2019s future kingship [see 1 Kings 11:29\u201340].<br />\n<br />\nALL EGYPTIAN PHAROAHs HAD KERALA HINDU THIYYA BLOODLINE.<br />\n<br />\nShishak invaded Palestine in the fifth year of Rehoboam, 925 B.C. He subdued Judah, taking the treasures of Jerusalem as tribute [see 1 Kings 14:25\u201326; 2 Chronicles 12:2\u201312]<br />\n<br />\nBASSSSS ?<br />\n<br />\nPAAAPI PETH BHARR GAYA ?<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c7030339560338783081\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6VOqqm-hCbM/XCa06XjAUxI/AAAAAAABfL4/E3K2A6jHNG0XTf7_mZb9kjj9WxD3GwmzQCK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. WHAT IS HER CONNECTION WITH PINARAYI VIJAYAN..<br />\n<br />\nWELL , THE LATE CAPT KRISHNAN NAIR WHO OWNS LEELA HOTEL CHAIN IS FROM KANNUR..<br />\n<br />\nCAPT KRISHNAN NAIR WAS MY WIFEs GRANDFATHERs SUB-CONTRACTOR IN KANNUR BEFORE HE MADE IT BIG IN THE TEXTILE HANDLOOM EXPORT BUSINESS. HE HITCHED UP WITH GLORIA VANDERBILT --WITH A BRAND LEELA LACE..<br />\n<br />\nLEELA IS CAPT KRISHNAN NAIRs WIFE -- SHE ATTENDED MY WIFEs WEDDING EVE CELEBRATIONS..<br />\n<br />\nMY WIFEs GRANDFATHER HAD THE FIRST CAR AND TELEPHONE IN KANNUR , EVEN BEFORE THE KING.. GIVING COMPETITION TO ROTHSCHILDs COMMONWEALTH TRUST LTD IN CALICUT WHERE MY PARENTS WORKED ..<br />\n<br />\nANYWAYS CAPT KRISHNAN NAIR WAS ASKED BY PINARAYI VIJAYAN VIA A CONDUIT TO TELL MATA AMRITANANDA MAYI TO PROVIDE A SEAT FOR PINARAYI VIJAYANs DAUGHTER VEENA ( WHO HAS FINISHED PLUS TWO ) IN THE IT STRAIN.<br />\n<br />\nCAPT KRISHNAN NAIR WAS A MAJOR DONOR TO MATA AMRITANANDAMAYI AND SHE COULD NOT SAY NO.<br />\n<br />\nTHE MAN FRIDAY WHO MADE ALL THIS HAPPEN FOR CAPT KRISHNAN NAIR TOLD ME ALL THIS SEVERAL YEARS AGO .. EVERY JUICY DETAIL..<br />\n<br />\nSO YOU THOUGHT MATA AMRITANANDA MAYI IS A SAINT ?<br />\n<br />\nVEENA NOW IS IN BANGALORE--ALL KNOW WHO SHE IS IN THE IT FIELD..<br />\n<br />\nI CAN GIVE A BLOW BY BLOW ACCOUNT HOW VEENA GOT INTO THE COIMBATORE COLLEGE WITHOUT DONATION AND WITHOUT ADMISSION TEST.. WHO WAS HER UBER RICH LOCAL GUARDIAN ETC ..<br />\n<br />\nTODAY KERALA COMMIES GET EASY JOBS IN THE URALUNGAL CONTRACTORS--WHO GET JUICY CONTRACTS FROM THE COMMIE KERALA GOVT.. OR YOU BETRAY THE HINDUS..DONT SIT ON THE FENCE ....<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS A CASE AGAINST THE SABARIMALA TANTRI IN SUPREME COURT BY RABIDLY ANTI-HINDU FORCES THAT HE CLOSED THE NADA ( INNER SANCTUM DOOR ) BECAUSE FEMALES ENTERED THE SANNIDHANAM..<br />\n<br />\nTHE CASE IS THAT HE INSULTED WOMEN AND ALSO DISOBEYED THE SUPREME COURT ORDER... ALL DESH DROHI FORCES ARE CRYING \" BRAHMANICAL PATRIARCHY \"..<br />\n<br />\nCOME ON TV RIGHT NOW ...ALL 4 OF YOU....<br />\n<br />\nEXPLAIN TO THE PEOPLE OF INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nNO YAGNA IN SANATANA DHARMA IS A BLOOD SACRIFICE..<br />\n<br />\nALL YAGAMS ARE BLOODLESS..<br />\n<br />\nONLY DESI GHEE AND COCONUT WATER ( ELECTROLYTIC PLASMA ) IS SACRIFICED INTO THE FIRE..<br />\n<br />\nONE DROP OF BLOOD CANNOT FALL IN THE TEMPLE INNER SANCTUM.. ESPECIALLY IN TANTRIC TEMPLES..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE INVADER DID PROPAGANDA EXACTLY THE OPPOSITE AND HE FORCIBLY INTRODUCED BLOOD SACRIFICES USING HIS FAKE MUTTS..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA, THERE WERE ONLY 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS EACH UNDER A KERALA NAMBOODIRI...<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE WHITE INVADER ;EFT INDIA THERE WERE MORE THAN 1000 FAKE MUTTS, ALL WORKING AGAINST HINDUISM, HARASSING POOR HINDUS TO MAKE THEM SELF LOATHING AND CONVERT TO CHRISTIANITY..<br />\n<br />\nNO BRAHMIN EVER TROUBLED HINDUS.. EVERY PANCHATANTRA STORY STARTED WITH \" THERE WAS A POOR BRAHMIN \"..<br />\n<br />\nTHE EXCEPTION WAS KERALA WHERE 6000 YEARS AGO , WHEN THE RIVER SARASWATI DRIED UP , THE VEDAS ORAL ROUTE PROFICIENT BRAHMINS WERE KERALA NAMBOODIRIS ALONE..<br />\n<br />\nNAMBOODIRIS WERE PART OF THE DANAVA CIVILIZATION WHICH PRECEDED THE VEDIC CIVILIZAION BY SEVERAL MILLENNIUMS .. ADI SHANKARACHARYA, ARYABHATTA ( ARYAN BHATTATHIRIPAD ) AND CHANAKYA WERE KERALA NAMBOODIRIS -- ALL ARYANS..<br />\n<br />\n6000 YEARS AGO , PARASHURAMA BROUGHT THE NAMBOODIRI PROFESSORS FROM THE DRIED UP SARASWATI RIVER BANKS TO KERALA WITH 4 VEDAS AND 108 UPANISHADS..<br />\n<br />\nPARASHURAMA CREATED A SYSTEM WHERE KERALA NAMBOODIRIS ( ELDEST BROTHER ) HELD ALL LAND, THEY COULD MARRY 4 TIMES AND EVEN THE THIYYA KING COULD NOT COME WITHIN 6 FEET OF THEM ..<br />\n<br />\nNABOODIRIS THEMSELVES WERE THIYYAS -- BUT SANSKRIT AND VEDA ORAL ROUTE EXPERTS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE REASONS WERE BONAFIDE..<br />\n<br />\n1) TO PREVENT SUBDIVISION AND FRAGMENTATION OF LAND..<br />\n2) ONLY A MARRIED MAN CAN DO YAGNA IN SANATANA DHARMA ..<br />\n3) THE LOWEST STRATA COULD NOT COME WITHIN 72 FEET ( 12 MAN LENGTHS ) OF A KERALA NAMBOODIRI WHO WERE RECITING THE VEDAS ( DAILY ) ..THIS WAS TO PREVENT CORRUPTION OF THE ORAL ROUTE..<br />\n<br />\nVEDAS WENT ON ORAL ROUTE FOR 330 CENTURIES WITHOUT LOSING A SYLLABLE OR TONE BEFORE THEY WERE PENNED DOWN 70 CENTURIES AGO..THIS IS THE GREATEST FEAT OF MAN..<br />\n<br />\nGETTING BACK--<br />\n<br />\nBLOOD MUST REMAIN WITHIN THE LEATHER BAG OF THE HUMAN BODY INSIDE A SANCTUM OF THE TEMPLE..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHY MENSTRUATING AGE WOMEN ARE NOT ALLOWED ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE GENDER OF A HUMAN HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THIS...<br />\n<br />\nONE DROP OF BLOOD FROM THE INJURED BODY OF A TANTRI DISQUALIFIES HIM FROM DOING THE PUJA.. THIS BLOOD DOES NOT HAVE TO FALL ON THE GROUND..SAME PURIFICATION RITUALS APPLY..<br />\n<br />\nTHE PURIFICATION RITUAL IS EITHER GANGA WATER OR DESI HUMPED COW DUNG PASTE SPRINKLED ACCOMPANIED BY MANTRAS.<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE INVADER FOOLED THE HINDUS.. HE CAUSED ANIMAL AND HUMAN SACRIFICES TO HAPPEN INSIDE TANTRIC TEMPLES USING HIS FAKE MUTTS..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html<br />\n<br />\nTHIS BLOGSITE STOPPED THE ANNUAL COW MASSACRE AT GADHIMAI NEPAL.. BECAUSE OF THE COW SLAUGHTER , THE SELF LOATHING HINDU TURNED TO COMMUNIST ATHEISM..<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS THE WHITE INVADER WHO CREATED THAT LIE THAT BLOOD IS SACRIFICE COMPULSORY IN TANTRIC TEMPLES..<br />\n<br />\nEVERY SACRIFICE IN A HINDU TEMPLE IS A BLOODLESS SACRIFICE.. THE SACRIFICE IS GHEE AND ELECTROLYTIC PLASMA OF COCONUT WATER..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHY IN THE IDUMUKETTU THERE IS ONE COCONUT FILLED WITH DESI GHEE AND ANOTHER COCONUT UNBROKEN WHICH HAS THE LIQUID INSIDE.<br />\n<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/11/5900-year-old-sabarimala-this-planets.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c8286410734374761015-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c8286410734374761015-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c6666572926307895851\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\">\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2727712857677526907\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6VOqqm-hCbM/XCa06XjAUxI/AAAAAAABfL4/E3K2A6jHNG0XTf7_mZb9kjj9WxD3GwmzQCK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE CHIEF TANTRI SHUT DOWN THE SANCTUM FOR ONE HOUR AFTER TWO MENSTRUATING AGE WOMEN BINDU AND KANAKA DURGA WERE SMUGGLED IN AS TRANSGENDERS BY THE POLICE INSIDE AN AMBULANCE..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/01/god-code-by-timothy-paul-smith-damning.html?showComment=1546678902959#c2003528475874368338\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 5, 2019 at 2:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://english.mathrubhumi.com/news/kerala/banyan-tree-in-sabarimala-catches-fire-kerala-1.3454270<br />\n<br />\nTHE SABARIMALA BANYAN TREE CAUGHT FIRE A FEW HOURS AGO..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS TREE IS VERY OLD AND HAS NEVER CAUGHT FIRE THOUGH SINGED BY TALL ROARING FLAMES<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tnSaOrUywwc<br />\n<br />\n\u015br\u012b-bhagav\u0101n uv\u0101ca<br />\n\u016brdhva-m\u016blam adha\u1e25-\u015b\u0101kham<br />\na\u015bvattha\u1e41 pr\u0101hur avyayam<br />\nchand\u0101\u1e41si yasya par\u1e47\u0101ni<br />\nyas ta\u1e41 veda sa veda-vit<br />\nBhagawat Gita 15.1- 4000 BC<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe Supreme Personality of Godhead said: It is said that there is an imperishable banyan tree that has its roots upward and its branches down and whose leaves are the Vedic hymns. One who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.<br />\n<br />\nIn Bhagawat Gita Vishnu avatar Krishna tells Prince Arjuna before the great war 6000 years ago \" I am the Banyan tree \".<br />\n<br />\nKnown as the Kalpavriksha in Atharva Veda , the banyan tree symbolizes Trimurti - Lord Vishnu as the truck, Lord Brahma the roots, and Lord Shiva the branches.<br />\n<br />\nTHE BANYAN TREE IS IMMORTAL BECAUSE IT IS HAS A CLOSED LOOP FEEDBACK SYSTEM LIKE BRAHMAN .<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">BELOW: CAN ANY NATO JET DO THE TANGO ?</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/0_Cgxy7N-V0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0_Cgxy7N-V0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2jBeD0fXM0w/XCzLEGAF9dI/AAAAAAABfOk/IG0Q1Jiur8wGGsdrM0EFCwmMj49nLWI4ACLcBGAs/s1600/20180303_211945.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1600\" data-original-width=\"1232\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2jBeD0fXM0w/XCzLEGAF9dI/AAAAAAABfOk/IG0Q1Jiur8wGGsdrM0EFCwmMj49nLWI4ACLcBGAs/s640/20180303_211945.jpg\" width=\"492\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span><br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. IT SHOWS THE FAINT LIGHT AT THE END OF THE DARK TUNNEL.<br />\n<br />\nHOPE MAKES MAN THINK- I GUESS THINGS ARE FALLING INTO PLACE ( RATHER THAN FALLING APART )..<br />\n<br />\nYOUR CHOICES MUST REFLECT YOUR HOPES, NEVER REGRETS OR FEAR. THIS IS THE ONLY WAY TO REDUCE YOUR KARMIC BAGGAGE..<br />\n<br />\nREGRETS ARE MOSTLY THE CHANCES YOU DID NOT TAKE..<br />\n<br />\nONCE YOU CHOSE HOPE ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE..
