Then, on the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment (Luke\n23:55 to 24:1)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What was the purpose\nfor which the women went to the tomb?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To anoint Jesus body with spices (Mark 16: 1; Luke 23:55 to\n24: 1)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To see the tomb. Nothing about spices here (Matthew 28: 1)</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this gospel the wrapping with spices had been done\nbefore the Sabbath (John 20: 1)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large stone was\nplaced at the entrance of the tomb. Where was the stone when the women arrived?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They saw that the stone was Rolled back (Mark 16:4) They\nfound the stone rolled away from the tomb (Luke 24:2) They saw that the stone\nhad been taken away from the tomb (John 20:1)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the women approached, an angel descended from heaven,\nrolled away the stone, and conversed with the women. Matthew made the women\nwitness the spectacular rolling away of the stone (Matthew 28:1-6)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Did anyone tell the women what happened to Jesus body?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yes. A young man in a white robe (Mark 16:5). Two men ...\nin dazzling apparel later described as angels (Luke 24:4 and 24:23). An angel -\nthe one who rolled back the stone (Matthew 16:2). In each case the women were\ntold that Jesus had risen from the dead (Matthew 28:7; Mark 16:6; Luke 24:5\nfootnote)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No. Mary met no one and returned saying, They have taken\nthe Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid him (John\n20:2)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When did Mary\nMagdelene first meet the resurrected Jesus? And how did she react?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mary and the other women met Jesus on their way back from\ntheir first and only visit to the tomb. They took hold of his feet and\nworshipped him (Matthew 28:9)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On her second visit to the tomb Mary met Jesus just outside\nthe tomb. When she saw Jesus she did not recognize him. She mistook him for the\ngardener. She still thinks that Jesus body is laid to rest somewhere and she\ndemands to know where. But when Jesus said her name she at once recognized him\nand called him Teacher. Jesus said to her, Do not hold me... (John 20:11 to 17)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What was Jesus\ninstruction for his disciples?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tell my brethren to go to Galilee, and there they will see\nme (Matthew 2 8: 10)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Go to my brethren and say to them, I am ascending to my\nFather and your Father, to my God and your God (John 20:17)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When did the\ndisciples return to Galilee?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Immediately, because when they saw Jesus in Galilee some\ndoubted (Matthew 28:17). This period of uncertainty should not persist<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After at least 40 days. That evening the disciples were\nstill in Jerusalem (Luke 24:3 3). Jesus appeared to them there and told them,\nstay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high (Luke 24:49). He\nwas appearing to them during forty days (Acts 1:3), and charged them not to\ndepart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise ... (Acts 1:4)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who killed Saul?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saul took his own sword and fell upon it.... Thus Saul\ndied... (I Samuel 31:4-6)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An Amalekite slew him (2 Samuel 1:1- 16)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Does every man sin?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yes. There is no man who does not sin (I Kings 8:46; see\nalso 2 Chronicles 6:36; Proverbs 20:9; Ecclesiastes 7:20; and I John 1:810)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No. True Christians cannot possibly sin, because they are\nthe children of God. Every one who believes that Jesus is the Christ is a child\nof God.. (I John 5:1). We should be called children of God; and so we are (I\nJohn 3: 1). He who loves is born of God (I John 4:7). No one born of God\ncommits sin; for Gods nature abides in him, and he cannot sin because he is\nborn of God (I John 3:9). But, then again, Yes! If we say we have no sin we\ndeceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us (I John 1:8)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who will bear whose burden?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bear one anothers burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ\n(Galatians 6:2)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each man will have to bear his own load (Galatians 6:5)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How many disciples\ndid Jesus appear to after his resurrection?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Twelve (I Corinthians 15:5)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eleven (Matthew 27:3-5 and Acts 1:9-26, see also Matthew\n28:16; Mark 16:14 footnote; Luke 24:9; Luke 24:3 3)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where was Jesus\nthree days after his baptism?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After his baptism, the spirit immediately drove him out\ninto the wilderness. And he was in the wilderness forty days ... (Mark 1:12-13)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Next day after the baptism, Jesus selected two disciples.\nSecond day: Jesus went to Galilee - two more disciples. Third day: Jesus was at\na wedding feast in Cana in Galilee (see John 1:35; 1:43; 2:1-11)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Was baby Jesus life\nthreatened in Jerusalem?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yes, so Joseph fled with him to Egypt and stayed there\nuntil Herod died (Matthew 2:13 23)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No. The family fled nowhere. They calmly presented the\nchild at the Jerusalem temple according to the Jewish customs and returned to\nGalilee (Luke 2:21-40)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Jesus walked on\nwater how did the disciples respond?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They worshipped him, saying, Truly you are the Son of God\n(Matthew 14:33)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: aqua; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were utterly astounded, for they did not understand\nabout the loaves, but their hearts were hardened (Mark 6:51-52)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>TRUTH HAS ONLY ONE VERSION</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>LIES HAVE HAJAAAR VERSIONS ( IF YOU CANT REMEMBER THE FIRST LIE )</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis chapter 1 says\nthe first man and woman were made at the same time, and after the animals. But\nGenesis chapter 2 gives a different order of creation: man, then the animals,\nand then woman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis chapter 1 lists\nsix days of creation, whereas chapter 2 refers to the \u201cday that the Lord God\nmade the earth and the heavens.\u201d Genesis 1:2-3 claims that God created light\nand divided it from darkness on the first day; but Genesis 1:14-19 tells us the\nsun, moon, and stars weren\u2019t made until the fourth day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapter 1 reports that\nthe fruit trees were created before the man, while chapter 2 indicates they\nwere made after him. Genesis 1:20 says the fowl were created out of the waters;\nGenesis 2:19 alleges they were formed from the ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contradictions are also\nseen in the biblical story of a worldwide flood. According to Genesis 6:19-22,\nGod ordered Noah to bring \u201cof every living thing of all flesh, two of every\nsort . . . into the ark.\u201d Nevertheless, Genesis 7:2-3 relates that the Lord\nordered Noah to take into the ark the clean beasts and the birds by sevens, and\nonly the unclean beasts by twos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis 8:4 reports\nthat, as the waters of the flood receded, Noah\u2019s ark rested on the mountains of\nArarat in the seventh month. The very next verse, however, says the mountaintops\ncould not be seen until the tenth month.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis 8:13 describes\nthe earth as being dry on the first day of the first month. But Genesis 8:14\ninforms us the earth was not dry until the twenty-seventh day of the second\nmonth.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Old Testament\ncontains an interesting contradiction in the story of the census taken by King\nDavid and the resulting punishment of the Israelites. God was so angered by the\ncensus that he sent a plague that killed 70,000 men. According to II Samuel\n24:1, the Lord had caused David to take the census \u2013 which makes the punishment\nappear even more nonsensical.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">But an attempt was later made, at I Chronicles\n21:1, to improve God\u2019s image by claiming that Satan incited the census.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Old Testament is\ncontradictory as to whether the Lord commanded the Israelites to sacrifice\nanimals to him. At Jeremiah 7:22, God denies he ever gave the Israelites\ncommandments about animal sacrifices. In contrast, Exodus 29:38-42 and many\nother verses depict God as requiring the Israelites to offer animal sacrifices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the New Testament,\nthere are contradictions between the genealogies of Jesus given in the first\nchapter of Matthew and the third chapter of Luke.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both genealogies begin\nwith Jesus\u2019 father, who is identified as Joseph (which is curious, given that\nMary was supposedly impregnated by the Holy Ghost). But Matthew says Joseph\u2019s\nfather was Jacob, while Luke claims he was Heli. Matthew lists 26 generations\nbetween Jesus and King David, whereas Luke records 41. Matthew runs Jesus\u2019 line\nof descent through David\u2019s son Solomon, while Luke has it going through David\u2019s\nson Nathan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The story of Jesus\u2019\nbirth is also contradictory. Matthew 2:13-15 depicts Joseph and Mary as fleeing\nto Egypt with the baby Jesus immediately after the wise men from the east had\nbrought gifts.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But Luke 2:22-40 claims\nthat after the birth of Jesus, his parents remained in Bethlehem for the time\nof Mary\u2019s purification (which was 40 days, under the Mosaic law). Afterwards,\nthey brought Jesus to Jerusalem \u201cto present him to the Lord,\u201d and then returned\nto their home in Nazareth. Luke mentions no journey into Egypt or visit by wise\nmen from the east.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerning the death of\nJudas, the disloyal disciple, Matthew 27:5 states he took the money he had\nreceived for betraying Jesus, threw it down in the temple, and \u201cwent and hanged\nhimself.\u201d To the contrary, Acts 1:18 claims Judas used the money to purchase a\nfield and \u201cfalling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels\ngushed out.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In describing Jesus\nbeing led to his execution, John 19:17 recounts that he carried his own cross.\nBut Mark 15:21-23 disagrees by saying a man called Simon carried the cross.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As for the crucifixion,\nMatthew 27:44 tells us Jesus was taunted by both criminals who were being\ncrucified with him. But Luke 23:39-43 relates that only one of the criminals\ntaunted Jesus, the other criminal rebuked the one who was doing the taunting,\nand Jesus told the criminal who was defending him, \u201cToday shalt thou be with me\nin paradise.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regarding the last\nwords of Jesus while on the cross, Matthew 27:46 and Mark 15:34 quote Jesus as\ncrying with a loud voice, \u201cMy God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?\u201d Luke\n23:46 gives his final words as, \u201cFather, into thy hands I commend my spirit.\u201d\nJohn 19:30 alleges the last words were, \u201cIt is finished.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mark 16:2 states that\non the day of the resurrection, certain women arrived at the tomb at the rising\nof the sun. But John 20:1 informs us they arrived when it was yet dark. Luke\n24:2 describes the tomb as open when the women arrived, whereas Matthew 28:1-2\nindicates it was closed. Mark 16:5 declares that the women saw a young man at\nthe tomb, Luke 24:4 says they saw two men, Matthew 28:2 reports they saw an\nangel, and John 20:11-12 claims they saw two angels.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the resurrection stories, there are\ncontradictions as to the identity of the women who came to the tomb,whether the\nmen or angels the women saw were inside or outside the tomb, whether the men or\nangels were standing or sitting, and whether Mary Magdalene recognized the\nrisen Jesus when he first appeared to her.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a final example of a\nNew Testament contradiction, the conflicting accounts of Paul\u2019s conversion can\nbe cited. Acts 9:7 states that when Jesus called Paul to preach the gospel, the\nmen who were with Paul heard a voice but saw no man. According to Acts 22:9,\nhowever, the men saw a light but didn\u2019t hear the voice speaking to Paul.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instances of cruel and\nunjust behavior by the biblical God are seen in the most basic Christian\ndoctrines. Some of God\u2019s acts that harmed the innocent are as follows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He damned the whole\nhuman race and cursed the entire creation because of the acts of two people\n(Genesis 3:16-23; Romans 5:18); he drowned pregnant women and innocent children\nand animals at the time of the Flood (Genesis 7:20-23); he tormented the\nEgyptians and their animals with hail and disease because pharaoh refused to\nlet the Israelites leave Egypt (Exodus 9:8-11,25); and he killed Egyptian\nbabies at the time of the Passover (Exodus 12:29-30).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the Exodus he\nordered the Israelites to exterminate the men, women, and children of seven\nnations and steal their land (Deuteronomy 7:1-2); he killed King David\u2019s baby\nbecause of David\u2019s adultery with Bathsheba (II Samuel 12:13-18); he required\nthe torture and murder of his own son (e.g., Romans 3:24-25); and he promised\nto send non-Christians to eternal torture (e.g., Revelation 21:8).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Among the most shocking\nBible passages are those that portray God as ordering or approving the\nextermination of various people, including children and the elderly.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here are\nexamples:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At I Samuel 15:3, the\nprophet Samuel gives King Saul this commandment from the Lord: \u201cNow go and\nsmite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but\nslay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ezekiel 9:4-7 has this\nharrowing account: \u201cAnd the Lord said unto him, Go through . . . the midst of\nJerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry\nfor all the abominations that be done in the midst thereof. And to the others\nhe said in mine hearing, Go ye after him through the city, and smite: let not\nyour eye spare, neither have ye pity: Slay utterly old and young, both maids\nand little children, and women: but come not near any man upon whom is the\nmark. . . .\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hosea 13:16 describes a\npunishment from the Lord: \u201cSamaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled\nagainst her God: they shall fall by the sword: their infants shall be dashed in\npieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deuteronomy 32:23-25\nsays that after the Israelites incited God\u2019s jealousy by worshiping other gods,\nhe vowed: \u201cI will spend mine arrows upon them. . . . The sword without, and terror\nwithin, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with\nthe man of gray hairs.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Numbers chapter 31,\nthe Lord approves of these instructions that Moses gave to the Israelite\nsoldiers about how to treat certain women and children captured in war: \u201cNow\ntherefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman that hath\nknown man by lying with him. But all the women children, that have not known a\nman by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Isaiah 13:9,15-18 contains\nthis message from God: \u201cBehold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with\nwrath and fierce anger. . . . Every one that is found shall be thrust through.\n. . . Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes . . . and\ntheir wives ravished. Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them. . . . They shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eyes will not spare\nchildren.\u201d</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These verses expose the\nbiblical God as having the morals of a sociopathic mass murderer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The God of the Bible\ndisplayed his sadistic tendencies by employing a variety of other means to\ntorment and kill people.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He caused the earth to\nopen and swallow entire families (Numbers 16:37-32); he used fire to devour\npeople (e.g., Leviticus 10:1-2; Numbers 11:1-2); and he punished the Israelites\nwith wars, famines, and pestilences (e.g., Ezekiel 5:11-17).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He sent wild animals\nsuch as bears (II Kings 2:23-24), lions (II Kings 17:24-25), and serpents\n(Numbers 21:6) to attack people; he sanctioned slavery (e.g., Leviticus\n25:44-46); he ordered religious persecution (e.g., Deuteronomy 13:12-16); and\nhe caused cannibalism (Jeremiah 19:9).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c5200287595532521719\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px;
