He would beat up white whores after having deviant sex with them..<br />\n<br />\nTHE CUNTS IN THE VIDEO BELOW DO NOT KNOW THAT JESUS NEVER EXISTED..<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_XJiNohaAHQ</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>FILIPINOS NEVER ATE PIG BEFORE MAGELLAN STEPPED ON THE VISAYAN LAND.&nbsp; &nbsp;DUTERTE HAS HINDU VISYAN DNA IN REALITY.</b></span><br />\n<br />\nDUTERTE HIMSELF WAS ABUSED SEXUALLY BY A PADRE ..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Old Testament says\nthe Lord prescribed execution for the \u201ccrimes\u201d of working on the Sabbath\n(Exodus 31:15); cursing one\u2019s parents (Leviticus 20:9); worshiping other gods\n(Deuteronomy 17:2-5); enticing a friend or family member to worship other gods\n(Deuteronomy 13:6-10); being a witch, medium, or wizard (Exodus 22:18;\nLeviticus 20:27); engaging in homosexual acts (Leviticus 20:13); and not being\na virgin on one\u2019s wedding night (Deuteronomy 22:20-21).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the New Testament, God\nbecame far worse in regard to imposing excessively severe punishments. It would\nbe hard to imagine anything more cruel and disproportionate than punishing\npeople with eternal torture for mere disbelief that Jesus was the son of God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historical examples of\nviolent and unjust acts supported by biblical teachings include: the Inquisition;\nthe Crusades; the burning of witches; religious wars; pogroms against Jews;\npersecution of homosexuals; forceful conversions of heathens; slavery; beatings\nof children; brutal treatment of the mentally ill; suppression of scientists;\nand whippings, mutilations, and violent executions of persons convicted of\ncrimes. Those acts were a regular part of the Christian world for centuries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of the Bible\u2019s\nclaims are inconsistent with the laws of nature. &nbsp;These &nbsp;claims are both wrong and harmful.&nbsp; &nbsp;Bible\ndiscourages a scientific approach to problems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible has stories\nabout a talking snake (Genesis 3:4-5); a tree bearing fruit which, when eaten,\ngives knowledge of good and evil (Genesis 2:17; 3:5-7); another tree whose\nfruit bestows immortality (Genesis 3:22); a voice coming from a burning bush\n(Exodus 3:4); a talking donkey (Numbers 22:28); rods turning into serpents\n(Exodus 7:10-12); water changing into blood (Exodus 7:19-22); water coming from\na rock (Numbers 20:11); a dead man reviving when his corpse touched the bones\nof a prophet (II Kings 13:21); and other people rising from the dead (e.g., I\nKings 17:21-22; II Kings 4:32-35; Acts 9:37-40).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are also accounts\nof the sun standing still (Joshua 10:13); the parting of a sea (Exodus\n14:21-22); iron floating (II Kings 6:5-6); the sun\u2019s shadow going back ten\ndegrees (II Kings 20:9-11); a witch bringing the ghost of Samuel back from the\ndead (I Samuel 28:3-15); disembodied fingers writing on a wall (Daniel 5:5); a\nman living for three days and nights in the belly of a fish (Jonah 1:17);\npeople walking on water (Matthew 14:26-29); a virgin impregnated by God (Matthew\n1:20); a pool of water that can cure ailments of those who dip in it (John\n5:2-4); and angels and demons influencing earthly affairs (e.g., Acts 5:19;\nLuke 11:24-26).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN HINDUISM WE HAVE PURANAS WITH TALL STORIES WHERE GODS WERE PERSONALIZED TO FANCY THE ILLITERATE MAN ..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BUT IT IS VERY CLEAR THAT HINDU GODS WERE COSMIC ALLEGORIES..</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nFOR EXAMPLE GODDESS SARASWATI&nbsp; IS THE PRIMORDIAL LIGHT-- THE QUASAR , MORE BRILLIANT&nbsp; THAN A TRILLION SUNS..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Based on biblical\nteachings, Christian theologians during those centuries thought the plagues\nwere caused by the anger of God or the malevolence of Satan.&nbsp; &nbsp;The\nBible gave them ample support for their belief. It contains numerous instances\nof God punishing people by means of pestilence (e.g., Exodus 32:35; Numbers\n16:44-49; Jeremiah 21:6). And in describing Jesus\u2019 healing miracles, the New\nTestament attributes the following afflictions to demons: blindness (Matthew\n12:22); muteness (Matthew 9:32-33); lameness (Luke 13:11,16); epilepsy (Matthew\n17:14-18); and insanity (Mark 5:1-13).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those teachings led the\nearly church leaders to promote the idea that demonic activity is the primary\ncause of disease. For example, St. Augustine, whose views strongly influenced\nWestern thought for over a thousand years, said in the fourth century: \u201cAll\ndiseases of Christians are to be ascribed to these demons. . . .\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Martin Luther, the founder of Protestantism,\nrepeatedly attributed his own illnesses to \u201cdevils\u2019 spells.\u201d He also stated:\n\u201cSatan produces all the maladies which afflict mankind, for he is the prince of\ndeath.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/03/protestant-christianity-created-by-jews.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/03/protestant-christianity-created-by-jews.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result of\nbelieving in supernatural causes of disease, theologians taught that plagues\ncould be averted or stopped by seeking supernatural assistance. And the way to\nobtain God\u2019s help, they thought, was to perform religious acts. These included admitting\nthat you are a sinner and repenting from sin; &nbsp;providing gifts to churches, monasteries, and\nshrines; &nbsp;participating in religious\nprocessions; &nbsp;attending church services\n(which often only increased the spread of disease); &nbsp;and killing pagans and witches (since it was\nthought Satan used them as his agents in causing illness). Religious leaders\nlargely ignored the possibility of physical causes and cures of diseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Joshua, in order to\nhave a longer period of daylight in which to carry out the Lord\u2019s command to\nslaughter the Amorites, ordered the sun to stand still \u2013 not the earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other passages\ndemonstrating that the earth remains stationary include Psalm 93:1 (\u201cThe world\nis established, that it cannot be moved.\u201d); &nbsp;I Chronicles 16:30 (\u201c The world also shall be\nstable, that it be not moved.\u201d); &nbsp;and\nPsalm 104:5 (The Lord \u201claid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be\nremoved forever.\u201d).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHILE MILLENNIUMS BEFORE OUR VEDAS TALKED ABOUT PRECESSION AND EARTHS FREQUENCY OM.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.</span><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/05/vishnu-first-matysa-avatar-dolphins-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/05/vishnu-first-matysa-avatar-dolphins-and.html</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/05/vishnu-avatar-varaha-boar-fixing-planet.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/05/vishnu-avatar-varaha-boar-fixing-planet.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For generations the\nmajor branches of Protestantism \u2013 Lutheran, Calvinist, and Anglican \u2013 denounced\nthe Copernican doctrine as contrary to scripture.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible supports the\nprimitive notion of a flat earth. In the sixth century, a Christian monk named\nCosmas wrote a book, titled Topographia Christiana, describing the structure of\nthe physical world. Basing his views on the Bible, Cosmas said the earth is\nflat and surrounded by four seas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prophecy at\nRevelation 1:7 was a basis for his conclusion. It states that when Christ\nreturns, \u201cevery eye shall see him.\u201d Cosmas reasoned that if the earth were\nround, people on the other side would not see Christ\u2019s second coming.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Further support for the\nidea of a flat earth is contained in the verses mentioning the \u201cfour corners of\nthe earth\u201d (e.g., Isaiah 11:12; Revelation 7:1) and the \u201cends of the earth\u201d\n(e.g., Jeremiah 16:19; Acts 13:47).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As for the question of\nwhat holds the flat earth in place, the Bible indicates the answer is\n\u201cpillars.\u201d The pillars of the earth are mentioned in several verses in the Old\nTestament (I Samuel 2:8; Psalm 75:3; Job 9:6).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible promotes the\nidea that the sky is a solid dome covering the earth. In the creation account\ngiven in the first chapter of Genesis, verse 17 says the Lord set the sun and\nmoon \u201cin the firmament\u201d to provide light for the earth. The Hebrew word\ntranslated as firmament is raqia, which means \u201chammered metal.\u201d</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The third chapter of\nLuke contains a genealogy tracing Christ\u2019s ancestry back only 76 generations to\nAdam. According to Genesis chapter 1, Adam was created along with the rest of\nthe universe during the course of one week.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible says that the\nbig bang happened in 4004 BC, while Vedanta and the modern quantum theory\nagrees that it is around 15 billion years.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">None of the quantum\nscientists have categorized Vedanta as a religious work. They have perused and\nfound that it is a subtle mathematical or scientific analysis. Vedanta and\nmodern Quantum Mechanics describe the same subject\u2014ultimate reality\u2014from\nopposite points of view and perspective.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta says that we live in a time\nobstructed world using 5 narrow band senses -- and also a timeless realm in the\nquantum dimension, where what you see is NOT what you get.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More support for the\nnotion of a domed earth is found at Job 37:18 (where the sky is described as\nlike a \u201cmolten looking glass\u201d); Isaiah 40:22 (God \u201cstretcheth out the heavens\nas a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in\u201d); and Revelation\n6:14 (\u201cAnd the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together.\u201d).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This concept of the sky\nwas common in the ancient Near East and taken for granted by the Bible\nwriters.&nbsp; &nbsp;Based on the Bible, most of the early church\nfathers accepted the notion of the firmament.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;The same position was supported\nby Cosmas, and thus was part of orthodox Christian doctrine for several\ncenturies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orthodox doctrine also\ncontained the related idea that the firmament has windows \u2013 which are opened by\nangels when God wants to send rain upon the earth. Cosmas believed that when\nthe windows are opened, some of the waters contained above the firmament (which\nare mentioned at Genesis 1:17) fall to the earth. Cosmas\u2019 basis for this belief\nwas the statement, at Genesis 7:11-12, that at the time of the Noachian flood\nthe \u201cwindows of heaven were opened\u201d and the rain fell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"></span></b>\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Christians thought\ncomets warn of divine anger and imminent punishment;&nbsp; stars and meteors portend beneficial events\nsuch as the birth of heroes and great men; eclipses signify divine distress in\nresponse to events on earth; and storms and other destructive weather result\nfrom the anger of God or the malice of Satan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible has verses\nmentioning dragons (Jeremiah 51:34), unicorns (Isaiah 34:7), and cockatrices\n(Isaiah 11:8). These passages led many naturalists in the Middle Ages to think\nsuch mythical creatures actually exist.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible is also\nincorrect in saying the bat is a bird (Leviticus 11:13,19), the hare and rock\nbadger chew the cud (Leviticus 11:5-6), and the mustard seed \u201cis the smallest\nof all seeds\u201d (Matthew 13:32).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally, it\u2019s\ninconsistent with science \u2013 and ludicrous \u2013 to believe that God confounded the\nlanguage of humans because he was afraid they would build a tower high enough\nto reach heaven (Genesis 11:1-9).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bible&nbsp; contains a test for determining whether a prophecy was inspired by God.\nDeuteronomy 18:22 explains: \u201cWhen a prophet speaketh in the name of the Lord,\nif the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the Lord\nhath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not\nbe afraid of him.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis 2:17 says the\nLord warned Adam and Eve about the fruit contained on the tree of knowledge. He\nstated: \u201c &nbsp;In the day that thou eatest\nthereof thou shalt surely die.\u201d According to Genesis chapter 3, however, Adam\nand Eve ate the forbidden fruit and didn\u2019t die on that day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ADAM AND EVE IS LIFTED FROM SANATANA DHARMA..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ADAM and EVE story is\njust lifted from our Sanskrit Upanishads -&nbsp;\nthis story is the basis of the Abrahamic religions Judaism/ Christianity\n/ Islam. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All three religions\ndraw upon this STOLEN story from MUNDAKA Upanishad III, 1, 1-3 ( Genesis of the\nOld Testament ).. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This story and speaks\nof the tree of knowledge and God's commandment that its fruit shall not be\neaten. Adam at first did not eat it but Eve did. After that Adam too ate the\nforbidden fruit. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishad ORIGINAL\nstory is about two birds sitting on a peepal tree.&nbsp;&nbsp; The birds are PURUSHA (atman )and PRAKRITI (\njiva )-- with Purusha being the witness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HEY PRESTO--&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATMAN becomes\nADAM.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JIVA becomes EVE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">( J is silent in most\nareas ) --people call me AIT ( ayit ) instead of AJIT. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FIG which eve ate\nis the fruit of the peepal tree ( FICUS ) -- the true botanical name today is\nFICUS RELIGIOSA.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The old testament NEVER\nspoke of apple ( from a fig tree ) !</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Tree of Jiva and\nAtman appears in the Vedic scriptures, as a metaphysical metaphor concerning\nthe soul.&nbsp; These verses of Vedas went on\noral route for 330 centuries before being penned down 70 centuries ago..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rig Veda samhita\n1.164.20-22, Mundaka Upanishad 3.1.1-2, and Svetasvatara Upanisad 4.6-7, speak\nof two birds, one perched on the branch of the tree, which signifies the body,\nand eating its fruit, the other merely watching.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rig Veda samhita says:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.164.20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Two birds associated together, and mutual\nfriends, take refuge in the same tree; one of them eats the sweet fig; the\nother abstaining from food, merely looks on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.164.21 Where the\nsmooth-gliding rays, cognizant, distil the perpetual portion of water; there\nhas the Lord and steadfast protector all beings accepted me, though immature in\nwisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.164.22 In the tree\ninto which the smooth-gliding rays feeders on the sweet, enters, and again\nbring forth light over all, they have called the fruit sweet, but he partakes\nnot of it who knows not the protector of the universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first bird is\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">PURUSHA </b>( consciousness ) -HE is ATMAN .&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second bird is<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>\nPRAKRITI</b></span> ( energy ) - SHE is JIVA&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_20.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_20.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the jiva becomes\ndistracted by the fruits (signifying sensual pleasure), she momentarily forgets\nher lord and lover and tries to enjoy the fruit independently of him. This\nseparating forgetfulness is maha-maya, or enthrallment, spiritual death, and constitutes\nthe fall of the jiva into the world of material birth, death, disease and old\nage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This concept of Atman\nand Jiva have been personified and taken into the Bible as Adam and Eve and the\nfall of man.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis 35:10 claims\nthat God told Jacob: \u201c Thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel\nshall be thy name. . . .\u201d But 11 chapters later, the Lord\u2019s own act proved his\nprediction to be wrong. Genesis 46:2 relates: \u201cGod spake unto Israel in the\nvisions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here am I.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unfulfilled Old\nTestament prophecies include the following: the Jews will occupy the land from\nthe Nile to the Euphrates (Genesis 15:18); they shall never lose their land and\nshall be disturbed no more (II Samuel 7:10); King David\u2019s throne and kingdom\nshall be established forever (II Samuel 7:16); no uncircumcised person will\never enter Jerusalem (Isaiah 52:1); and the waters of Egypt will dry up (Isaiah\n19:5-7).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At Matthew 16:28, Jesus\ntells his disciples: \u201cThere be some standing here, which shall not taste of\ndeath, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.\u201d The people who were\nstanding there all died eventually, and they never saw Jesus return to\nestablish a kingdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similarly, Jesus is\ndepicted at Mark 13:24-30 as listing signs that shall accompany the end of the\nworld. These include the sun becoming darkened, the moon not giving any light, the\nstars of heaven falling, the son of man coming in the clouds with great power\nand glory, and angels gathering the elect. Then Jesus announces: \u201cVerily I say\nunto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.\u201d\nHis generation passed away long ago without the predicted events occurring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus also erred in\npredicting the amount of time he would be in the tomb. At Matthew 12:40 he\nteaches: \u201cFor as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale\u2019s belly; so\nshall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.\u201d\nMark 15:42-45 shows that Jesus died on a Friday afternoon. But Mark 16:9 and\nMatthew 28:1 tell us he left the tomb sometime on Saturday night or Sunday\nmorning. Either way, the amount of time was less than three nights.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another significant\nfalse prophecy is at John 14:13-14. Jesus promises: \u201cWhatsoever ye shall ask in\nmy name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If ye ask\nany thing in my name, I will do it.\u201d Everyone knows there have been millions of\ninstances where Jesus failed to respond to Christians who asked for things in\nhis name. And the graveyards are full of people who prayed to him for health.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The book of Exodus\nclaims to contain a historical record of the escape of the Israelites from\nslavery in Egypt. But historians and archaeologists have been unable to verify\nany of the events described in the book. No known Egyptian records refer to the\nbiblical Moses, the devastating plagues God supposedly inflicted on the\ncountry, the escape of the Hebrew slaves, or the drowning of the Egyptian army.\nFurther, &nbsp;the records contained on\nEgyptian monuments show that the pharaoh ruling at the time of the alleged\nescape of the Jews was certainly not overwhelmed in the Red Sea.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matthew chapter 2 avers\nthat shortly after the birth of Jesus, King Herod ordered the massacre of all\nmale children two years of age or under in Bethlehem and its vicinity. In the\nbook of Luke, which contains the only other New Testament story of Jesus\u2019\nbirth, there is no mention of this cruel order. It\u2019s also not recorded\nin any histories from the time \u2013 not even by writers who carefully\ndescribed many far less wicked deeds of Herod. &nbsp;The lack of corroboration means Matthew\u2019s\naccount was fabricated.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matthew 27:45 alleges\nthat while Jesus was on the cross, there fell over the whole land a darkness\nlasting from midday until three in the afternoon. There are no records of\nthis.&nbsp; Though Romans such as Seneca and\nPliny carefully described much less striking occurrences of the same sort in\nmore remote regions, they failed to note any such darkness occurring even in\nJudea.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There still exist &nbsp;works of more than 60 historians or\nchroniclers who lived in the period from 10 C.E. to 100 C.E.&nbsp; Those writers were contemporaries of Jesus (\nwho never existed )..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The harm that the Bible\ncauses in people\u2019s personal lives should be mentioned as a reason for rejecting\nthe book. It\u2019s not uncommon to see media reports about Bible believers\ncommitting bizarre, injurious, and sometimes deadly acts.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cathloic nations are\nthe most decadent of planet earth.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Some people use Bible\nverses to justify beating children, withholding medical treatment, mortification\nof flesh, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">drinking poison, chopping off\nbody parts, plucking out eyes, driving out demons, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">and expecting the world to end.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the Bible were not viewed as God\u2019s word,\nthese acts would occur much less often.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead of being\ninerrant, the Bible has far more errors and immoral teachings than any other\nbook other than Torah.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By treating this\nmistake-ridden book as the word of God, humanity has been led down many paths\nof error and misery throughout history. In too many ways, the Bible continues\nto produce such results.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But in some cases, the\nerrors caused by the Bible have been corrected and the harms have been stopped.\nThis happened when a scientific approach was applied to problems. Science\ninvolves relying on reason, observation, experience, and compassion \u2013 rather\nthan blindly accepting religious or mindless dogma.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">We should reject the views of those who say the\nBible has infallible answers to today\u2019s problems.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English word\n\"Bible\" is from the Greek phrase ta biblia, \"the books,\" an\nexpression Hellenistic Jews used to describe their sacred books several\ncenturies before the time of Jesus. Christians adopted the phrase \"Old\nTestament\" to refer to these sacred books they shared with Jews.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jews called the same\nbooks Miqra, \"Scripture,\" or the Tanakh, an acronym for the three\ndivisions of the Hebrew Bible: Torah (\"instructions\" or less\naccurately \"the law\"), Neviim (\"prophets\"), and Kethuvim\n(\"writings,\" including Psalms, Proverbs, and several other books).\nModern scholars often use the term \"Hebrew Bible\" to avoid the\nconfessional terms Old Testament and Tanakh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original texts of\nthe Hebrew Scriptures (Old Testament) and Christian Scriptures (New Testament)\nwere written in Hebrew, Greek, and occasionally in Aramaic.&nbsp; Very few adults can read any of these ancient languages.\nSo most of us have to rely upon English translations.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reader cannot\nalways trust the translators. Bibles contain many inaccuracies and errors. Some most are intentional.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most versions of the\nBible are sponsored by one or more Christian denominations. Thus, translators\ntend to have similar belief systems. Some denominations have long standing\nprejudices against other religions, sexual minorities, etc. This sometimes\naffects the accuracy of their translation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matthew 6:13: The\nLord's Prayer traditionally ends: \"For thine is the kingdom, and the\npower, and the glory, for ever. Amen.\" This is absent in the original\nwritings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matthew 17:21 is a\nduplicate of Mark 9:29. It was apparently added by a copyist in order to make\nMatthew agree with Mark. But Mark 9:29 also contains a forgery; this makes\nMatthew 17:21 a type of double-layered forgery<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John 7:53 to 8:11: One\nof the most famous forgeries &nbsp;in the\nBible is the well-known story of the woman observed in adultery. It was\napparently written and inserted after John 7:52 by an unknown author, perhaps\nin the 5th century CE. This story is often referred to as an \"orphan story\"\nbecause it is a type of floating text which has appeared after John 7:36, John\n7:52, John 21:25, and Luke 21:38 in various manuscripts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The status of verses\nJohn 8:1-11 are not certain.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mark 9:29: Jesus\ncomments that a certain type of indwelling demon can only be exorcised through\n\"prayer and fasting\" (KJV) This is also found in the Rheims New\nTestament. But the word \"fasting\" did not appear in the oldest\nmanuscripts. &nbsp;Many new English\ntranslations have dropped the word.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mark 16:9-20: The\noriginal version of Mark ended rather abruptly at the end of Verse 8. Verses 9\nto 20, which are shown in most translations of the Bible, were added later by\nan unknown forger. The verses were based on portions of Luke, John and other\nsources.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Luke 3:22: This passage\ndescribes Jesus' baptism by John the Baptist&nbsp;\n. The original version of this verse has God speaking the words:\n\"You are my son, today have I begotten thee.\"</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The implication is that\nJesus was first recognized by God as his son at the time of baptism. But a\nforger &nbsp;altered the words to read:\n\"You are my son, whom I love.\" The altered passage conformed more to\nthe evolving Christian belief that Jesus was the son of God at his birth, (as\ndescribed in Luke and Matthew) or before the beginning of creation (as in\nJohn), and not at his baptism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John 5:3-4: These\nverses describe how \"a great multitude\" of disabled people stayed by\nthe water. From time to time an angel arrived, and stirred the waters. The\nfirst person who stepped in was cured. This passage seems strange. The process\nwould not be at all just, because the blind could not see the waters being\nstirred, and the less mobile of the disabled would have no chance of a cure.\nPart of Verse 3 and all of Verse 4 are missing from the oldest manuscripts of\nJohn. It appears to be a piece of free-floating magical text that someone added\nto John.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John 21: The original\nversion of the Gospel of John ended at the end of John 20. John 21 is forged.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corinthians 14:34-35:\nThis is a curious passage. It appears to prohibit all talking by women during\nservices. But it contradicts verse 11:5, in which St. Paul states that women can\nactively pray and prophesy during services. It is obvious that verses 14:33b to\n36 are a fake later addition, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Revelation 1:11: The phrase\n\"Saying, I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and,\" which is\nfound in the King James Version was not in the original Greek texts. It is also\nfound in the New King James Version (NKJV) and in the 21st Century King James\nVersion (KJ21) The latter are basically re-writes of the original KJV.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Modern English, is used, but the translators\nseem to have made little or no effort to correct errors. &nbsp;The Alpha/Omega phrase is not found in any\nancient texts, nor is it mentioned, even as a footnote, in any modern\ntranslation ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There were about 40\ngospels, large numbers of epistles, and even a few books on the style of\nRevelation that were considered religious texts by various movements within the\nearly Christian church. When some of these were selected to form the official\ncanon of the Christian Scriptures (New Testament), the main criteria was\nwhether the book appeared to be written by an apostle or someone very close to\nan apostle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The canon was regarded as inerrant and as inspired by God. It still\nis by most conservative Christians. Liberal theologians have reached a\nconsensus that many books in the New Testament were not written by the authors\nthat they claim to be written by. This puts their legitimacy in question. We\nalso know that unknown persons later inserted their own writings into some&nbsp; books.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genesis, Exodus,\nLeviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy (a.k.a. The Pentateuch, the 5 Books of\nMoses, the Books of the Law, the Law, the Torah). These state in numerous\nplaces that they were written by Moses. But mainline and liberal theologians\nhave long accepted the \"Documentary Hypothesis\" which asserts that\nthe Pentateuch was written by a group of four authors, from various locations\nin Palestine, over a period of centuries. Each wrote with the goal of promoting\nhis own religious views. A fifth individual cut and pasted the original\ndocuments in to the present Pentateuch.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FAKE gospels were\nwritten after 325 AD after Jesus was cooked up at the first Council of Nicea..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The text of various Pauline epistles state\nthat they were written by Paul. &nbsp;It is\nobvious that that Ephesians, 2 Thessalonians, 1 &amp; 2 Timothy and Titus were\nwritten by persons unknown, mostly in the 4<sup>th</sup>&nbsp; century.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other epistles of\nunknown authorship, &nbsp;are Hebrews, James,\n2 Peter, 1, 2 &amp; 3 John, and Jude.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Revelation was written\nby an unknown author - perhaps a Jewish Christian whose primary language was\nAramaic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Twelve apostles of\nJesus never existed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simon: called Peter by\nJesus &nbsp;and Simon Peter, a fisherman from\nBethsaida \"of Galilee\" (John 1:44; cf. 12:21) Simon/Peter - Andrew's\nbrother (Matthew 10:2; Mark 3:16; Luke 6:14), Mary's husband, Mark's father (1\nPeter 5:13; Acts 12:12) and Barnabas' brother-in-law (Acts 15:39; Colossians\n4:10<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Andrew: brother of\nPeter, a Bethsaida fisherman and disciple of John the Baptist, and also the\nFirst-Called Apostle. (Matthew 10:2; Mark 3:18; Luke 6:14) and Mark's uncle\n(Matthew 4:18)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">James - John's brother,\nson of Zebedee, Boanerges, son of Thunder (Matthew 10:2; Mark 3:17; Luke 6:14)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John son of Zebedee,\ncalled by Jesus Boanerges (an Aramaic name explained in Mk 3:17 as \"Sons\nof Thunder\") - James' brother (Matthew 10:2; Mark 3:17; Luke 6:14)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Philip: from Bethsaida\n\"of Galilee\" (John 1:44, 12:21) (Matthew 10:3; Mark 3:18; Luke 6:14)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thaddeus: \"Judas,\nson of James\", (Matthew 10:3, Acts 1:13, Luke 6:16, John 14:22).\nLebbaeus/Judas/Juda - , Simon's brother (Matthew 10:3; 13:55; Mark 3:18; 6:3;\nLuke 6:16; Jude 1:1)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bartholomew: in Aramaic\n\"son of Talemai\" or from Ptolemais, some identify with Nathanael.\n(Matthew 10:3; Mark 3:18; Luke 6:14)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thomas: also known as\nJudas Tomas (Matthew 10:3; Mark 3:18; Luke 6:15)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">James: &nbsp;Matthew's/Levi's brother, son of Alphaeus (Matthew\n10:3; 27:56; Mark 2:14; 3:16, 18; 6:3; 15:40, 47; Luke 5:27; 6:14-15; 24:18;\nActs 1:13; 4:36).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matthew: the tax\ncollector, (Matthew 10:3; 27:56; Mark 2:14; 3:16, 18; 6:3; 15:40, 47; Luke\n5:27; 6:14-15; 24:18; Acts 1:13; 4:36) and author of the Book of Matthew<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simon the Canaanite:\ncalled in Luke and Acts \"Simon the Zealot\", &nbsp;(Matthew 10:4; 13:55; Mark 3:18; 6:3; Luke\n6:15)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judas Iscariot: The\ntraitor. (Matthew 10:4; Mark 3:19; Luke 6:16)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus Christ names 12\napostles to spread his gospel, and the early Christian church owes its rapid\nrise to their missionary zeal. Yet, for most of the Twelve, there's scant\nevidence of their existence outside of the New Testament.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People have &nbsp;walked hundreds of miles along the Camino de\nSantiago pilgrim route in northern Spain, visited the place where Judas\nIscariot ( who never existed ) ly hanged himself. The locals there don\u2019t know\nabout him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/the-dirty-secret-of-christian.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/the-dirty-secret-of-christian.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the coattails of the\nGnostic wave set in motion by The Da Vinci Code, and using the same media ploys\nof sensationalism, psychological impact and moral-emotional shock, the National\nGeographic Society has launched its new product: The Gospel of Judas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The release says the\ndocument was \u2018copied down in Coptic probably around 400 AD. Gnostics believed\nthat their direct knowledge of heaven permitted them to understand what no one\nelse knew, or could know by historical knowledge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For ancient Gnostics to\nbelieve in their own powers of divination is charming; for their flights of\nimagination to be passed off as historical knowledge in our time is dishonest\nor self-deceived.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/06/science/06cnd-judas.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/06/science/06cnd-judas.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gospels were cooked\nup after 325 AD.&nbsp; &nbsp;The four canonical gospels \u2014 Matthew, Mark,\nLuke and John \u2014 were written as the &nbsp;main\nsource of information on the life of Jesus, who never existed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All four are anonymous,\nthe modern names were added in the 4<sup>th</sup> century. All four are\nanonymous (the modern names were added in the 2nd century).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gospel According to\nMark is the most important of the synoptic gospels because it is the primary\nsource for Matthew and Luke. Seventy six percent of Mark is reproduced almost\nword-for-word in both Matthew and Luke.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;An additional 18% of Mark is reproduced\nin Matthew but not in Luke, and an further 3% of Mark is in Luke but not in\nMatthew. This means that 97% of Mark is reproduced in Matthew and/or Luke.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matthew contains 606 of\nMark\u2019s 661 verses. Luke contains 320 of Mark\u2019s 661 verses. Of the 55 verses of\nMark which Matthew does not reproduce, Luke reproduces 31; therefore there are\nonly 24 verses in all of Mark not reproduced somewhere in Matthew or Luke.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gospel of Mark is\nthe first of the Gospels to proffer quotes from Jesus- who never existed..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the end of the 4th\ncentury the tradition of Matthew the tax-collector had become widely accepted,\nand the line \u201cThe Gospel According to Matthew\u201d began to be added to manuscripts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Talmud </b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">is the central\ntext of Rabbinic Judaism and the primary source of Jewish religious law (halakha)\nand Jewish theology. Until the advent of modernity, in nearly all Jewish\ncommunities, the Talmud was the centerpiece of Jewish cultural life and was\nfoundational to \"all Jewish thought and aspirations\", serving also as\n\"the guide for the daily life\" of Jews. The Talmud is the basis for\nall codes of Jewish law, and is widely quoted in rabbinic literature. The\nTalmud is mainly used as a practical guide for deciding in matters of Halakha\n(Jewish law). The Talmud will take a passage from the Torah and discuss it and\nwhat the passage means, why something was written in a specific way- it is a\nhuman artifact. The nearest corollary is the Hadiths of Islam. The Hadiths are\nnot regarded as inspired by God, but are valued to varying degrees within their\nrespective Islamic sects and traditions. The Tamud can be viewed in a similar\nway in Judaism. Jews are guided in their behavior more by the Talmud (which is\nman-made) than the Torah (which presumably is God-made).&nbsp; Judaism is a rabbinic&nbsp; religion more than&nbsp; a \"biblical or scriptural\"&nbsp; religion.. Talmud is 70% Aramaic.. Talmud has\na fixed pagination, so one refers to the exact page in Talmud.. Talmud has two\nversions: Babylonian (main) and Jerusalem.&nbsp;\nTalmud is studied thoroughly in the Orthodox Jewish educational system..\nThe Talmud is like the Supreme Court rulings, which show how to interpret the\nconstitution. The Talmud contains 63 tractates (volumes) in 2711 leaves (double\npages). Without the oral tradition which is recorded in the Talmud, Judaism\ncould not be practiced, because stand-alone scripture is too ambiguous to\nunderstand for any practical purpose. Talmud is literally the Hebrew word for\n\u201clearning,\u201d and is sometimes referred to as the six orders of the Mishnah. The\nTalmud contains the history of the Jewish religion, as well as their laws and\nbeliefs. It is the basic tool for learning the ethics behind the customs of\ntheir religion.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\">BELOW: UNDERSTAND THE EVIL TALMUD</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ZrFOCjwdNro/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZrFOCjwdNro?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/09/tears-of-palestine-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/09/tears-of-palestine-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Torah </b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">( Law) has a\nrange of meanings. It can most specifically mean the first five books\n(Pentateuch- Genesis, Exedus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy. &nbsp;) of the 24 books of the Tanakh, and is\nusually printed with the rabbinic commentaries (perushim). It can mean the\ncontinued narrative from the Book of Genesis to the end of the Tanakh\n(Malachi), and it can even mean the totality of Jewish teaching, culture and\npractice, whether derived from biblical texts or later rabbinic writings.\nCommon to all these meanings, Torah consists of the origin of Jewish\npeoplehood: their call into being by God, their trials and tribulations, and\ntheir covenant with their God, which involves following a way of life embodied\nin a set of moral and religious obligations and civil laws.. The Torah is very\nholy , it is the Hebrew Bible.. it contains the 613 commandments.&nbsp;&nbsp; According to Jewish tradition, God handed\ndown the Torah directly to Moses, who dutifully reordered it word for word. It\nis the Written Word. Torah is 100% Hebrew.. Torah is printed freely, and is\nreferenced by chapters. Torah is complete till the last letter. There\u2019s a\ncommandment to read the Torah outloud in public. Written printed Torah is\nalways punctuated and vocalized.. The Torah is like a Constitution. It's\nwritten and it cannot be amended. Torah is the administrator's guide, Talmud is\nthe user's guide. There is also no such thing as the New Testament in the\nscriptures of the Jews.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VLs-OvJRNIE/XCjhegx_7PI/AAAAAAABfM4/37CT29tfyB0oJqOu6Cd9r9f7vUxebv_WQCLcBGAs/s1600/Akethuboth58.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
